jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Account Executive (AE) is a highly motivated self-starter who is responsible for developing and closing new business or expanding our footprint with current customers in an assigned geographic territory. A successful AE is eager to learn, determined to adapt quickly and comfortable with some ambiguity. AEs are focused on selling additional use cases, products and services into existing accounts. The AE is accountable for exceeding monthly and quarterly quotas, proactive deal management, forecast accuracy and driving adoption and usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Regional Vice President, Commercial Sales and is designated Flex. Responsibility Drive success of the company’s goals and objectives by achieving individual sales quotas Build and manage a sales pipeline through prospecting efforts into a geographic territory or within the core verticals Develop and deliver customized sales presentations and product demonstrations, by phone and via online demo Develop and negotiate enterprise-level proposals and contracts Forecast sales activity and revenue achievements accurately through proper use of sales tools Collaborate effectively and engage various pre- and post-sales resources including Sales Development Representatives, Market Development Representatives, Solutions Engineers, Account Managers, Partner Account Managers, as well as legal, security, professional services and customer support Travel as necessary, typically 25% What you bring Basic BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience 5+ years of direct software sales experience in an enterprise account executive or equivalent quota-carrying role Preferred 8+ years of SaaS sales experience selling into Financial Services Experience selling web-based products and services Experience managing and closing complex sales cycles Demonstrated ability to over-achieve quotas (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Proficient computer application skills, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Life at DocuSign Working here DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com. Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice

jobTitle: Account Executive - Mid Market (Healthcare & Life Sciences)
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do This Account Executive (AE) will be responsible for developing and closing existing business (use cases) by selling DocuSign's services to targeted accounts within the Legal vertical. They will acquire new customers and sell additional use cases, products and services into existing accounts. AEs are accountable for exceeding monthly/quarterly quota, forecasting accuracy, closing, and driving adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and partners. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Regional Vice President, Commercial Sales and is designated Remote. Responsibility Serve as the primary driving force in company’s revenue and customer success objectives through the attainment of assigned monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quota Conduct discovery calls with customers and prospects to understand organizational structure, key decision makers, procurement processes, IT systems, and document workflow Uncover customer document process and needs in order to match customer requirements to DocuSign solutions Understand, position and clearly articulate the value/benefits of DocuSign eSignature and Digital Transaction Management (DTM) solutions to all levels within customer organizations Leverage marketing slide decks and other materials, build custom sales presentations and demonstrations to client needs, and present by phone, webinar, and/or in-person Qualify, build, and manage a sales pipeline through the development of MDR/SDR qualified leads, proactive prospecting, networking, and online social channels including LinkedIn Draft customer proposals, demonstrate sound decision-making abilities, and negotiate client pricing requirements and concessions within DocuSign guidelines Serve as the “quarterback” and primary point of contact for aligning internal DocuSign teams and resources with key customer and prospect stakeholders Develop short, mid and long-term strategic and tactical execution plans to ensure success in assigned territory, vertical market, and/or key account base Generate, develop, manage, and communicate expectations within assigned accounts as well as increases scope of penetration within each account Demonstrate organizational leadership by mentoring junior sales team members and provide increasingly high levels of impact to ensure company-wide success Forecast monthly and quarterly sales activity and revenue achievement What you bring Basic BS/BA degree or equivalent experience 2+ years of experience in an AE role or equivalent quota-carrying role Willingness to travel as necessary Preferred 5+ years SaaS sales experience Experience selling web-based products and services Experience managing and closing complex sales cycles Demonstrated ability to over-achieve quotas (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Proficient computer application skills, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Familiar with Google suite This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams Strong ability to create process documentation visualizations Strong ability to create/maintain cross-team relationships and partnerships 4+ years of Revenue Operations, Sales, Customer Success, Enablement experience Experience at a company with multiple product offerings servicing both Commercial and Enterprise customers This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Communications and Enablement Manager will engage on our most strategic company initiatives, driving holistic engagement and enablement strategies that will drive awareness, understanding, acceptance and adoption. Your strategies will define the comms objectives, key themes and tactics, phases and timeline, and more. In this role, you will transform behaviors and mindsets to drive end user adoption and achieve desired business outcomes. You will develop compelling communications and engagement materials, meeting users where they are (i.e. townhall slides, newsletters, emails, Slack posts, etc.). You will drive engagement and enablement communications, and will provide thought leadership, develop and gain buy-in on comms strategies and ensure the comms strategies align to the change assessment and phases. Successful candidates will be able to quickly build rapport and trust-based relationships and collaborate effectively across training, communications, project and business teams. You will engage with senior leaders, program teams, and partner with the Business and Enablement leads, as applicable, and supporting functions to deliver and execute holistic strategies. You will execute with empathy and have a passion for connecting the dots for impacted users and their leadership. This is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director, Change Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Identify impacted audiences by completing stakeholder analysis and impact assessments, defining personas, areas of resistance, motivators, etc. Craft holistic, right-sized engagement, enablement and communication strategies Partner with business owners to define and monitor engagement and enablement metrics, pivoting as needed Partner with team members to develop plans consistent with our change strategy, approach and branding Develop and maintain engagement plans, including feedback strategies, to ensure materials and deliverables are on track and delivered Partner with stakeholders and technology team members to identify upcoming changes and integration points, and develop plans accordingly to proactively prepare and enable impacted audiences Develop a flexible strategy and methodology to drive holistic adoption in partnership with the Director of Adoption and Change Transformation (ACT) What you bring Basic 5+ years of experience in the enablement, engagement and/or comms space (or combination), developing strategies, executing plans and delivering content Experience creating and facilitating stakeholder engagement strategies to enable end users on behavioral changes (people, process, tool, data) across varied audiences and technologies Experience creating and operationalizing change networks, communities of super users, etc. to gain insights and drive adoption throughout the enterprise Experience managing engagement plans Experience managing consultants to execute on key deliverables to achieve outcomes Preferred Passionate about the user experience and thrives on developing effective materials for a wide base of people and personas Ability to own our strategies beyond project delivery to ensure we meet our goals Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage stakeholders across the organizations, drive consensus and a shared understanding Thrives in a fast-paced environment and can flex and prioritize based on new information and program changes Track record of converting ideas to impact Problem-solver with proven experience managing multiple unique projects and stakeholder groups This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $105,400 - $145,000 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $112,500 - $154,725 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Customer Success Engineer (CSE) is the primary technical contact for accounts that have Enterprise Premier Support and are entitled to a designated support engineer who is an expert in their use cases, implementation, and installation. The CSE maintains all aspects of the technical relationship, from troubleshooting possible issues, filing and advocating for enhancements, partnering with engineering and sales, preparing for new releases and rollouts and otherwise participating in the overall account management support of the customer. The CSE will manage all of their customers' cases, ensuring that accurate resources are leveraged, monitoring time to resolution, advocating bug fixes, managing sensitive and business critical issues impacting either the customer’s business or impacting DocuSign's relationship with the customer, and in general doing everything possible to bring a speedy resolution to the issue. The CSE will own the primary technical relationship with our Enterprise Premium Support customers. Within this relationship they will arrange meetings, broker and arbitrate meetings between the customer and DocuSign, and in all appropriate ways represent their customer’s technical needs to DocuSign, and DocuSign’s offerings to their customer. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager, Customer Success Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Manage and cultivate the technical relationship and communication with Enterprise Premium accounts Drive resolution of complex production issues, including escalation, system testing, strategy sessions and distribution of knowledge throughout the company Acquire and maintain knowledge of existing systems and new systems in order to provide accurate assistance and training to customers and CSE Team Act as a trusted technical advisor for DocuSign products and advanced DocuSign features, such as our APIs, DocuSign Connect, Powerforms, Templates, Embedding Signing Interface with internal groups for problem resolution and issue escalation Act as the liaison and customer advocate inside DocuSign Ensure consistent delivery of all Enterprise Premium Support program components Participate in special projects, as required, under general supervision that enhances the quality or efficiency of the CSE Team and support service (e.g., monitoring overall queue statues) Contribute to Sales’ ability to sell Enterprise Premium Support and identify upsell opportunities and new use cases Advocate and evangelize the Enterprise Premium Support program Travel as necessary (10-20%) What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience in technical customer support with one year as a senior team member or as a web developer Due to government contract requirements: Candidate must be a U.S. citizen Candidate must be able to clear a government agency-specific background investigation and may be required to undergo additional background checks, including fingerprinting, drug testing, and/or other government-required investigations to obtain and/or maintain security clearance(s) Preferred Knowledge of DocuSign product Understanding of desktop operating systems including but not limited to Microsoft Windows and Apple OS Experience using Salesforce.com Knowledge of web services, C#, PHP, Java or Ruby Understanding of HTML, JavaScript, CSS, XML, REST and SOAP API Web Development experience Familiarity with Mobile Applications Understanding of Software as a Service Ability to identify and submit product enhancement requests Ability to navigate and troubleshoot in ticketing systems, Bug submission and other support systems Passion for business, technology and customers Strong presentation skills Strong account management, cross-group collaboration, and negotiation skills Quickly develops rapport and credibility Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant field This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $93,700 - $128,875 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $100,000 - $137,575 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. The CSE will manage all of their customers' cases, ensuring that accurate resources are leveraged, monitoring time to resolution, advocating bug fixes, managing sensitive and business critical issues impacting either the customer’s business or impacting DocuSign's relationship with the customer, and in general doing everything possible to bring a speedy resolution to the issue. The CSE will own the primary technical relationship with our Enterprise Premium Support customers. Within this relationship they will arrange meetings, broker and arbitrate meetings between the customer and DocuSign, and in all appropriate ways represent their customer’s technical needs to DocuSign, and DocuSign’s offerings to their customer. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager, Customer Success Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Manage and cultivate the technical relationship and communication with Enterprise Premium accounts Drive resolution of complex production issues, including escalation, system testing, strategy sessions and distribution of knowledge throughout the company Acquire and maintain knowledge of existing systems and new systems in order to provide accurate assistance and training to customers and CSE Team Act as a trusted technical advisor for DocuSign products and advanced DocuSign features, such as our APIs, DocuSign Connect, Powerforms, Templates, Embedding Signing Interface with internal groups for problem resolution and issue escalation Act as the liaison and customer advocate inside DocuSign Ensure consistent delivery of all Enterprise Premium Support program components Participate in special projects, as required, under general supervision that enhances the quality or efficiency of the CSE Team and support service (e.g., monitoring overall queue statues) Contribute to Sales’ ability to sell Enterprise Premium Support and identify upsell opportunities and new use cases Advocate and evangelize the Enterprise Premium Support program Travel as necessary (10-20%) What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience in technical customer support with one year as a senior team member or as a web developer Due to government contract requirements: Candidate must be a U.S. citizen Candidate must be able to clear a government agency-specific background investigation and may be required to undergo additional background checks, including fingerprinting, drug testing, and/or other government-required investigations to obtain and/or maintain security clearance(s) Preferred Knowledge of DocuSign product Understanding of desktop operating systems including but not limited to Microsoft Windows and Apple OS Experience using Salesforce.com Knowledge of web services, C#, PHP, Java or Ruby Understanding of HTML, JavaScript, CSS, XML, REST and SOAP API Web Development experience Familiarity with Mobile Applications Understanding of Software as a Service Ability to identify and submit product enhancement requests Ability to navigate and troubleshoot in ticketing systems, Bug submission and other support systems Passion for business, technology and customers Strong presentation skills Strong account management, cross-group collaboration, and negotiation skills Quickly develops rapport and credibility Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant field This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $93,700 - $128,875 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $100,000 - $137,575 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Life at DocuSign Working here DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is a high-energy strategy-focused customer advisor responsible for a portfolio of selected strategic and enterprise companies, driving return on our customers’ investment in the DocuSign Agreement Cloud and unlocking further modernization across their system of agreement. The CSM will define, develop and execute effective customer adoption and success strategies. The CSM is able to discuss and advise on core functionality and features beyond the fundamentals, and the art of what is possible. Working with resources across the Customer Success organization and DocuSign, the CSM helps customers realize business results by serving as the post-sale conduit for our customers. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager of Customer Success Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Serve as thought leader, customer advocate and partner to DocuSign’s most strategic customers Develop and execute success plans in collaboration with Sales and Customer Success partners to reflect a holistic path to a modernized system of agreement Analyze usage patterns to provide insights and guidance Liaise between customer and internal teams at DocuSign Gain consensus with key customer stakeholders Measure the results of executed strategies to determine their efficacy Drive cross-functional opportunities for adoption growth Deliver adoption-related insights and readouts of specific customer outcomes Propel execution of “Success Plan” and associated customer interactions Identify customer resource requirements and dependencies and address gaps Collaborate and communicate with Sales/Support to ensure alignment on plans Drive transparency of current execution states for the assigned portfolio What you bring Basic BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience 8+ years of customer-facing experience managing to successful and proven outcomes 5+ years of SaaS experience Preferred Experience with enterprise platforms such as ECM, Document Management, Contract Management, or BPM systems Project management, business process reengineering and change management methodology knowledge and/or first-hand experience Salesforce and Gainsight experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to conduct value analysis around ROI Deep subject matter expertise in at least one industry. This should include fluency in any regulatory or compliance requirements Self-motivated, highly collaborative, creative, goal- and growth-oriented, and team-centric Ability to build effective strategy (both with our customers and internally) and couple it with execution Ability to interact with and influence all levels from individual contributors to executives Proven record of meeting performance goals This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $99,300 - $136,500 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $105,500 - $145,025 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Digital Marketing Measurement Director is a marketer-first. The individual must have a strong understanding of awareness and performance marketing, demand funnel principles, marketing attribution methodologies as well as customer and prospect journeys. The role will include frequent collaboration with business partner teams, helping to evaluate campaign performance and design new approaches to improve campaign effectiveness and efficiency. Visualization and communication of program output and performance will be a daily part of this role - spending time working with Salesforce data, CDP and Snowflake data. This role is not intended to build corporate- level reporting, but rather to provide digital marketers with frequent insight into how their actions are creating impact - or not. The person in this role will partner closely with the digital marketing team while collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders from GTM strategy, finance, database marketing, digital business, and demand generation teams. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP, Digital Marketing and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead acquisition marketing and brand marketing campaign analysis, measuring acquisition marketing campaign performance, measure channel incrementality, enhance ROI model for performance and brand marketing. Channels include performance media, such as Display, OLV, Paid Social, Paid Search, Content syndication, Organic search and brand media, such as TV, OTT, Streaming Audio, Podcast Build testing framework to enable A/B test across audience, creatives, offers etc, incrementality measurement for performance and brand advertising Ongoing business intelligence - Create cross channel performance dashboard to inform efficiency and as an input for media mix, provide on-going channel and campaign performance analysis Planning and forecasting for digital marketing, leading forecast efforts for annual planning and update quarterly forecast, opportunity sizing for new initiatives Evolve attribution model towards multi-touch attribution and ROI model towards measuring LTV What you bring Basic Bachelor’s degree 12+ years of experience with digital marketing data and analysis Demonstrated ability to connect paid media tools, CDP, marketing automation, CRM and social media reporting tools with Google Analytics to gain integrated digital marketing insights Experience with attribution modeling Strong data visualization experience Deep experience in data analysis and report generation with Excel and Tableau Strong technical abilities (SQL, Python, etc) and experience working with databases Expert knowledge in digital metrics, dimensions and KPIs Data science acumen: experimentation with new data, analytical models and techniques Exceptional attention to detail Ability to work independently, proactively identify potential issues and work towards solutions Results-oriented team player with the ability to build and maintain productive relationships with peers and cross-functional teams Excellent organizational and time management skills and ability to effectively manage multiple projects, set priorities, and execute on tight deadlines Preferred 5+ years experience marketing analytics for B2B and/or SaaS products Experience with analytics platforms, customer data platform and upper funnel analysis for awareness campaigns Highly motivated, organized, self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment Creative problem-solver and analytical thinker Powerful written and verbal communication skills Familiarity with: Paid media channels, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Google Tag Manager, LiveRamp, Optimizely, Tableau, Qliksense, CDP, Demandbase, Eloqua This Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Digital Marketing Measurement Director is a marketer-first. The individual must have a strong understanding of awareness and performance marketing, demand funnel principles, marketing attribution methodologies as well as customer and prospect journeys. The role will include frequent collaboration with business partner teams, helping to evaluate campaign performance and design new approaches to improve campaign effectiveness and efficiency. Visualization and communication of program output and performance will be a daily part of this role - spending time working with Salesforce data, CDP and Snowflake data. This role is not intended to build corporate- level reporting, but rather to provide digital marketers with frequent insight into how their actions are creating impact - or not. The person in this role will partner closely with the digital marketing team while collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders from GTM strategy, finance, database marketing, digital business, and demand generation teams. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP, Digital Marketing and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead acquisition marketing and brand marketing campaign analysis, measuring acquisition marketing campaign performance, measure channel incrementality, enhance ROI model for performance and brand marketing. Channels include performance media, such as Display, OLV, Paid Social, Paid Search, Content syndication, Organic search and brand media, such as TV, OTT, Streaming Audio, Podcast Build testing framework to enable A/B test across audience, creatives, offers etc, incrementality measurement for performance and brand advertising Ongoing business intelligence - Create cross channel performance dashboard to inform efficiency and as an input for media mix, provide on-going channel and campaign performance analysis Planning and forecasting for digital marketing, leading forecast efforts for annual planning and update quarterly forecast, opportunity sizing for new initiatives Evolve attribution model towards multi-touch attribution and ROI model towards measuring LTV What you bring Basic Bachelor’s degree 12+ years of experience with digital marketing data and analysis Demonstrated ability to connect paid media tools, CDP, marketing automation, CRM and social media reporting tools with Google Analytics to gain integrated digital marketing insights Experience with attribution modeling Strong data visualization experience Deep experience in data analysis and report generation with Excel and Tableau Strong technical abilities (SQL, Python, etc) and experience working with databases Expert knowledge in digital metrics, dimensions and KPIs Data science acumen: experimentation with new data, analytical models and techniques Exceptional attention to detail Ability to work independently, proactively identify potential issues and work towards solutions Results-oriented team player with the ability to build and maintain productive relationships with peers and cross-functional teams Excellent organizational and time management skills and ability to effectively manage multiple projects, set priorities, and execute on tight deadlines Preferred 5+ years experience marketing analytics for B2B and/or SaaS products Experience with analytics platforms, customer data platform and upper funnel analysis for awareness campaigns Highly motivated, organized, self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment Creative problem-solver and analytical thinker Powerful written and verbal communication skills Familiarity with: Paid media channels, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Google Tag Manager, LiveRamp, Optimizely, Tableau, Qliksense, CDP, Demandbase, Eloqua This jobTitle: Director, Engineering – Infrastructure and Storage Systems
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is looking for a seasoned hands-on Software Engineering Director to join our storage infrastructure team that is focused on building highly scalable, available, and reliable distributed storage systems. The Storage Systems team at DocuSign ensures critical back-end services scale with the company’s continued rapid growth. Our storage systems handle billions of transactions daily with tens of thousands of transactions per second with single digit millisecond average response times. The storage team at DocuSign tackles complex challenges as we scale the service for our next 10X growth. If you share our passion and excitement building robust, resilient distributed systems, this is the team for you. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director of Engineering, Storage Systems and is designated Flex. Responsibility Monitor performance of individual contributors and help manage their professional development Manage, analyze and approve product design and changes Design core, back-end software components Manage code solutions to challenging technical problems Conduct design and code reviews Manage and analyze and improve efficiency, reliability, and scalability of core services What you bring Basic BS in CS, EE or equivalent Experience managing engineering leads 12+ years of hands-on software development experience Experience in building large-scale, highly available and reliable applications Preferred Proficiency working with algorithms, data structures and production troubleshooting Familiarity with MS Stack Experience with operating system internals, database system internals and file systems, and networking Excellent communication and collaboration skills and demonstrated technical leadership ability This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As a Director of Engineering, you will be directly responsible for designing, engineering, and delivering the evolution of our Observability platform. Delivering high scale and highly available systems is part of the DocuSign engineering culture and our success in this revolves around our ability to understand how our systems are operating at all times and where we need to invest in to harden and improve them. We build complex distributed systems and our ability to do this successfully is dependent on the platforms and software you will build. Our ‘live site' is the lifeblood of our engineering organization and the tooling you will work on ensures we can deliver on our commitments to customers. In support of these goals, you will build high scale distributed systems with a focus on improving the development and operational experiences across our engineering organization. This position is a people manager reporting to the Director of Engineering and is designated as Flex. Responsibility Be a technical leader within your team and across the engineering organization Partner with our developers and SREs to provide tooling and services to enhance the observability of the system Design, develop and ship services in support of improving our observability goals Engineer high scale, fault tolerant distributed systems observability systems Improve tooling to capture metrics, logs, traces at scale and building systems to make sense of that data through dashboard and visualizations What you bring Basic BS in CS, EE, Informatics or similar 12+ years of experience in software engineering Solid coding skills in C#, C++, Go or equivalent modern infrastructure languages Preferred Experience managing engineering leads Experience with modern observability tooling (Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, Grafana, etc.) Experience with big data architecture, big data platform and pipelines Experience with cloud services at scale on AWS, Azure and GCP Familiarity with observability in physical deployments, container environments and distributed micro services This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do DocuSign is looking for a highly experienced and motivated Director of Indirect Tax to lead all-company indirect tax functions, including sales and use tax, GST, VAT, property tax and other non-income business taxes. This is an individual contributor role reporting to Head of Tax and is designated Flex. Responsibility Manage all indirect tax functions, including compliance and reporting Manage indirect tax risk globally – closely monitoring the dynamic landscape and assessing and implementing operational and compliance changes, as required Manage product taxability configurations and system enablement – including nexus settings, product mappings, and enterprise application processes and enhancements Provide indirect tax support to the business - including customer invoice and taxability support, customer and vendor contract review, customer exemption certificate advice, and ERP support Support mergers and acquisitions, including, but not limited to indirect tax exposure analyses, remediation, and integration Mange Indirect tax reserves and SOX Manage audits and VDAs Support the team in building comprehensive processes; ensuring timely, accurate and well documented deliverables Manage outside consultants Support and develop direct reports and other members of the Tax Team What you bring Basic Bachelor’s degree, with emphasis in accounting or finance Minimum of 12 years of corporate tax and/or public accounting experience, including 8 years of recent sales tax and VAT experience Preferred Master’s degree in Tax or Accounting and/or CPA Public company multinational corporation experience and/ or Public accounting firm experience (i.e. Big 4) Commitment to continuous improvement Ability to develop and motivate team members Excellent analytical skills Detail oriented Highly effective communication skills (verbal and written) Ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently while successfully delivering results Ability to act with a sense of urgency This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As a Director of Engineering for the DocuSign AI Applied science team, you are responsible for leading the core team of applied scientists working on the foundational ML models of our next gen agreement analytics products, services and developer platform. The Intelligent DAP (DocuSign Agreement Platform), is built on a foundation that includes a set of critical building blocks such as a specialized agreement repository. The team will leverage state of the art machine learning techniques for both natural language processing and computer vision to improve how agreements are drafted, summarized, signed, managed, and queried. The ideal candidate should have experience with all aspects of building, tuning, and evaluating machine learning models, including deep learning architectures (e.g. convolutional and transformer architectures). Your team will be responsible for delivering solutions for generative modeling, summarization, named entity recognition, information extraction, semantic search, question answering, and recommendations. You’ll be expected to leverage pretrained models, which can then be adapted to a new domain and fine-tuned for specific tasks. Data augmentation can be helpful. Distillation and quantization may be required. Experience with multilingual modeling, active learning, and/or contextual bandit methods is a plus. You will prototype machine learning models that deliver more personalized and automated customer experiences throughout the DocuSign Agreement Platform. You will bring your technical chops and team building chops together to lead a world class team to successfully take on this unique responsibility. You will exemplify a flexible attitude combined with an aptitude to learn and share. You will embrace and enhance our culture and be a role model. This position is a people manager role reporting toSenior Director, Engineering – DocuSign AI and is designated Flex. Responsibility Hire, grow and lead a world class applied science team Lean in to leadership to deliver success against our goals Be responsible for building our high scale models, Deep Neural net strategy for search relevance, query processing and clause classification Champion strong fundamentals (reliability, resiliency, data privacy, security, compliance) for these platform services assets Be responsible for several V1 (new) initiatives to enhance and unlock new and innovative use cases for our customers Build learning organizations that mentor your team Deliver products that delight customers while managing the health of the code base through continuous refactoring and management of technical debt Provide coaching and leadership in applied science for best practices, modeling and evaluation techniques, responsible AI, model interpretability and machine teaching What you bring Basic 12+ years' of combined machine learning & management experience across multiple ML frameworks like Pytorch, TensorFlow, etc 5+ years hands on Deep neural network, computer vision, natural language processing 5+ years managing applied science organizations over 10 people or equivalent experience Preferred Demonstrated track record leading geographically dispersed teams 8+ years of experience in designing, developing, deploying and monitoring machine learning and deep learning solutions Experience programming in Python and machine learning frameworks, including PyTorch, TensorFlow, hugging face, etc Strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages - Python, C#, Java, C/C++ This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $165,600 - $233,850 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $178,300 - $251,875 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As the Director, Product Management - Developer Platform, you will lead the efforts to develop the roadmap, vision, and priorities for DocuSign’s Developer and Apps Platform, which includes the experience by which external partners build custom integrations with DocuSign. As a champion of developers and customers alike, you will drive measurable impact by enabling a thriving ecosystem of tools and services connected to our Agreement Cloud. Using qualitative and quantitative insights, you will define and deliver innovative developer-facing products, including tools, SDKs, and APIs, along with mechanisms for third-party partners to distribute and monetize their integrations. You will also define the life cycle and experience for customers to find and manage integrations within their organizations. You will manage a team of highly motivated individuals and support their continued career growth. You will champion a product management culture that focuses on delivering impact, data-driven decision making and fast yet diligent execution. Product Managers at DocuSign are the CEOs of their product and ship features that make our customers successful. PMs work cross-functionally with customers, Sales, Marketing, Engineering, UX, Support, etc. to define product vision, gather requirements, execute on the feature and drive product launches. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Director of Product Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead the strategy and roadmap for the DocuSign developer platform Attract, manage, and develop a talented, diverse, equitable and inclusive team of product managers Apply your understanding of developer and business audiences to drive a rich and thriving ecosystem of partner-built integrations, as well as customer adoption of those solutions. Understand market and customer needs by closely working with Partners, Customers, User Research, Data Science, and Marketing Define and continuously monitor, measure and report on key business and customer metrics Prioritize opportunities, define requirements and execute cross-functionally (Engineering, Design, Data Science, User Research, etc.) to take features from concept to launch Collaborate with Engineering, Marketing, Pricing, Legal, UX, and other cross-functional teams What you bring Basic 12+ years of experience in Product Management 3+ years of experience hiring, managing, and developing product managers Experience in building technical products, such as cloud services and APIs Bachelor’s degree Preferred Proven track record of innovation and scaling existing products Excellent written and verbal communication, including experience presenting to senior executive audiences Experience building developer-facing products, such as APIs/SDKs, and/or two-sided B2B marketplaces Master’s degree This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $165,600 - $233,850 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $178,300 - $251,875 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Director of Sales Development is responsible for managing the Sales Development Representative (SDR) organization consisting of 90 SDRs to effectively work marketing leads in order to generate high-quality pipelines for the sales organization to drive and close. The ideal SDR Director has prior sales development experience leading a team of managers along with a proven sales track record in delivering business results. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Vice President of Sales Development, North America and is designated Flex. Responsibility Grow Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) in defined vertical markets and geographic territories from Commercial and Enterprise accounts Manage SDR Managers daily Assess sales pipeline, activity and forecasts to determine sales progress and areas for refinement/improvement Coach leaders to develop their leadership and sales skills including coaching and development, forecasting, prospecting and other necessary skills, while maintaining individual accountability to goals Maintain and protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned team members and leading by example Identify opportunities for pipeline and business growth; test new ideas, objectively evaluate success and failure, effectively implement successes Work collaboratively with Marketing Demand Generation leadership, Sales Operations, and other internal organizations to develop and execute lead flow and pipeline generation initiatives Work with multiple Account Executive (AE) leadership teams to ensure SDR and AE organizations work effectively, collaborative, and quality pipeline is being developed and managed Set and manage quotas, KPIs, and key prospecting activities Operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment without requiring significant supervision What you bring Basic 8+ years of sales or sales development management experience BA/BS from an accredited college or university Preferred 6+ years of sales or sales development management experience in SaaS-based offerings Experience managing large teams (30+ sales reps) Experience managing managers Strong sales development and/or sales closing experience Proven track record for attaining sales/sales development targets Proven track record of building a positive team culture, motivating people, developing people in their career Strong interpersonal, collaboration, and communication skills Capable of analyzing data, identifying trends, making data-driven decisions Proven ability to work within cross-functional teams to develop and lead joint initiatives, work together collaboratively and productively to solve issues Comfortable with change, trying and testing new ideas This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As the Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Account Executive (AE), you are a highly motivated self-starter who thrives in a high growth, fast paced, collaborative environment. You are eager to learn, determined to adapt quickly, and comfortable with some ambiguity. You are responsible for developing and closing new business and expanding our footprint in current customers by selling additional products and services within an assigned geographic territory or vertical. You are accountable for exceeding quarterly and annual quotas, proactive deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption and usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Regional Vice President, Enterprise Corporate Sales and is designated Flex. Responsibility Drive success of the company’s goals and objectives through achieving individual sales quotas Build and manage a sales pipeline through prospecting efforts into a geographic territory or within the core verticals Craft and deliver customized sales presentations and product demonstrations, by phone and via online demo Develop and negotiate enterprise level proposals and contracts Forecast sales activity and revenue achievements accurately through proper use of sales tools Collaborate effectively and engage various pre/post sales resources including Sales Development Representatives, Market Development Representatives, Solutions Engineers, Enterprise Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, Renewal Managers, Partner Account Managers, as well as Legal, Security, Professional Services and Customer Support Travel as necessary, typically 10% What you bring Basic BS/BA degree or equivalent experience 2+ years of direct full cycle, software sales experience in a quota-carrying role Preferred 3+ years SaaS sales experience Experience selling web-based products/services Experience managing and closing complex sales cycles Demonstrated ability to over-achieve quotas (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Proficient computer application skills, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Familiar with Google suite Excellent verbal and written communication skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado hourly pay range: $26.06/hour - $31.90/hour and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $27.45 - $33.62 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As the Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Account Executive (AE), you are a highly motivated self-starter who thrives in a high growth, fast paced, collaborative environment. You are eager to learn, determined to adapt quickly, and comfortable with some ambiguity. You are responsible for developing and closing new business and expanding our footprint in current customers by selling additional products and services within an assigned geographic territory or vertical. You are accountable for exceeding quarterly and annual quotas, proactive deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption and usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Regional Vice President, Enterprise Corporate Sales and is designated Flex. Responsibility Drive success of the company’s goals and objectives through achieving individual sales quotas Build and manage a sales pipeline through prospecting efforts into a geographic territory or within the core verticals Craft and deliver customized sales presentations and product demonstrations, by phone and via online demo Develop and negotiate enterprise level proposals and contracts Forecast sales activity and revenue achievements accurately through proper use of sales tools Collaborate effectively and engage various pre/post sales resources including Sales Development Representatives, Market Development Representatives, Solutions Engineers, Enterprise Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, Renewal Managers, Partner Account Managers, as well as Legal, Security, Professional Services and Customer Support Travel as necessary, typically 10% What you bring Basic BS/BA degree or equivalent experience 2+ years of direct full cycle, software sales experience in a quota-carrying role Preferred 3+ years SaaS sales experience Experience selling web-based products/services Experience managing and closing complex sales cycles Demonstrated ability to over-achieve quotas (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Proficient computer application skills, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Familiar with Google suite Excellent verbal and written communication skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado hourly pay range: $26.06/hour - $31.90/hour and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $27.45 - $33.62 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Life at DocuSign Working here DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com. Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice

What you'll do The ER Business Partner will be responsible for the effective completion of sensitive employee concerns and HR related issues. Additionally, they will analyze casework trends to produce strategic, proactive recommendations to HR Business Partners and the business to proactively address and mitigate systemic issues. As the subject matter experts, they will consult and collaborate with business partners in all matters related to employee relations. This position is an individual contributor reporting to the Senior Director, Employee Relations, and is designated Flex. Responsibility Conduct effective, thorough, and objective investigations of varying levels of difficulty and sensitivity Manage assigned casework independently, bringing investigations to closure rapidly and definitively Balance time between projects and crisis-response is a critical component for success in the position Analyze casework trends to provide proactive recommendations to HR and the business to proactively address and mitigate systemic issues Consult and collaborate with business partners, and Legal teams on complex employee investigations and matters What you bring Basic 5+ years of experience in conducting investigative work, including claimant, witness, and accused employee interviews, investigative data analysis, and production of investigative documentation Understanding of federal and state employment and labor laws Experience developing and maintaining collaborative working relationships in a consulting environment Experience handling confidential and sensitive matters Preferred Strong coaching, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Advanced degree, such as a Juris Doctor, or other specialized training in labor/employee relations Fluent in Portuguese, Spanish or Japanese Demonstrated passion for employee relations, investigations, and labor/employment law Experience in a high-tech environment This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Enterprise Account Executive cultivates and closes new Enterprise-level relationships, specifically within the Mid-Atlantic region, quarterbacking deals from start to finish. This role will be a hybrid of net-new relationships and existing growth within targeted accounts. The ideal candidate will be curious by nature, a strategic hunter, and possess strong relationship-building skills. You'll work for the company who created DTM and leads the industry; you’ll sell products that you believe in; you’ll help introduce change to the way your customers live and work; you’ll work with competitive commission and stock plan structures that reward your efforts; and you’ll experience career growth and opportunity based on personal achievement. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Regional Vice President, Enterprise and is designated Flex. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. What you'll do The Go to Market Budget Analyst supports the global marketing team with all aspects of vendor and budgeting processes. From contract to payment, the Go to Market Budget Analyst will collaborate cross-functionally to manage all aspects of our budgeting process with Purchasing, Legal, Marketing Leadership, and Finance to manage program spend throughout DocuSign. The role requires strong organizational and communication skills and the ability to support and execute complex cross-functional initiatives in the midst of competing priorities. This position is an individual contributor reporting to Manager, GTM Budget and is designated Flex. Responsibility Assist with planning and budget cycle across the Go To Market organization Partner with Finance Business Partners to create trackers that provide real-time updates on program budgets/spend Provide cross functional and top down visibility into all programs and budgets Manage Vendor Onboarding, Purchasing, Contract Execution, Accruals, Amortizations, and Invoicing for program and budget owners What you bring Basic BA/BS degree 2+ years of experience in a SaaS company Experience in Oracle/Netsuite (or other ERP systems), Excel, Salesforce Experience working with Purchase Agreements, Statements of Work, Master Service Agreements, and Process Documentation Preferred Strong customer service focus, written and verbal communication skills, and attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to take initiative, work flexibly, and collaborate with cross functional partners Team player with sight on the end goal. Ability to see the big picture and work with a team to prioritize requests, ensuring delivery alignment without compromising goals Detailed, organized, and results oriented Ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environment Ability to provide support to global teams and collaborate across time zones Experience communicating with leadership and presenting independent analysis to a wide variety of stakeholders This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado hourly pay range: $29.28/hour - $38.08/hour and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City hourly pay range: $31.30/hour - $40.68/hour and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. What you'll do The Go-to-Market Strategy Manager is a key member of our Worldwide Field organization. Your work will focus on shaping our business strategy to drive long-term success within our existing customer base, while unlocking near-term performance and growth opportunities. You will do this through a combination of analytical insight, strong business acumen, and robust cross-functional partnerships with leaders in Sales, Marketing, Product, Customer Success, Enablement, Finance, HR, etc. Why should you be excited about this role? You enjoy driving change in a business and seeing fast results. You have high aspirations, and you are excited to help scale a category-defining business through its next phase of growth. You’re able to roll up your sleeves to analyze the data, then shift to storytelling and building a compelling narrative. You have a growth mindset and are energized by building relationships across the organization. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, GTM Strategy and is designated as Flex. Responsibility Conceptualize and execute GTM initiatives to improve the growth and retention of our customer base Provide data-driven insights on install base performance throughout the customer lifecycle Identify and address gaps in the go-to-market strategy for our customer base Assist with ad hoc analytical requests and projects Become a trusted advisor to DocuSign field and business leadership Partner with cross-functional leadership to “connect the dots” and drive success within our customer base What you bring Basic BA/BS degree in a business/quantitative field or equivalent experience 8+ years of experience in GTM strategy, management consulting, investment banking, or corporate analytical roles Preferred MBA or other advanced degree Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills Comfortable with ambiguity and working in a fast-paced environment Experience and/or high interest to work in a high growth or SaaS company Effective, clear, and concise verbal and written communication skills Experience presenting to senior leadership Results-driven, self-motivated, and able to work independently Structured thinker with strong organizational skills High degree of intellectual curiosity and self confidence Equal parts thinker and doer Salesforce proficiency Fluent in SQL, with knowledge of relational databases and data warehouses This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do The Go-to-Market Strategy Manager is a key member of our Worldwide Field organization. You’re able to roll up your sleeves to analyze the data, then shift to storytelling and building a compelling narrative. You have a growth mindset and are energized by building relationships across the organization. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, GTM Strategy and is designated as Flex. Responsibility Conceptualize and execute GTM initiatives to improve the growth and retention of our customer base Provide data-driven insights on install base performance throughout the customer lifecycle Identify and address gaps in the go-to-market strategy for our customer base Assist with ad hoc analytical requests and projects Become a trusted advisor to DocuSign field and business leadership Partner with cross-functional leadership to “connect the dots” and drive success within our customer base What you bring Basic BA/BS degree in a business/quantitative field or equivalent experience 8+ years of experience in GTM strategy, management consulting, investment banking, or corporate analytical roles Preferred MBA or other advanced degree Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills Comfortable with ambiguity and working in a fast-paced environment Experience and/or high interest to work in a high growth or SaaS company Effective, clear, and concise verbal and written communication skills Experience presenting to senior leadership Results-driven, self-motivated, and able to work independently Structured thinker with strong organizational skills High degree of intellectual curiosity and self confidence Equal parts thinker and doer Salesforce proficiency Fluent in SQL, with knowledge of relational databases and data warehouses This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do We are seeking an experienced leader, reporting to both the Chief Financial Officer and the Audit Committee, to direct our internal audit function and continue to develop our high-performing team of professionals. The primary responsibility will be overseeing audit engagements, reviews, testing, and reporting for financial and operational audits projects. Additionally, they will assist with other compliance and special projects, as well as support the company’s business process efforts. Therefore, DocuSign is seeking an execution-oriented and strong leader who can work across the broader organization and manage our various audit requirements. The ideal candidate possesses software industry experience, with a focus on performing audits under Generally Accepted Auditing Standards (GAAS), Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) auditing standards, SOC compliance and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX). The leader must have a firm grasp of technical accounting, including revenue recognition, financial reporting (GAAP and non-GAAP), and other related topics. Additional areas of topical breadth include operational audit projects, other compliance standards, ERM, data privacy, cybersecurity, investigations and special projects. Furthermore, the candidate must have the ability to effectively manage internal and external partners (external auditors, outsourcing partners, and fellow colleagues) who assist us with projects and testing, demonstrate proficient project management skills, superior communication (written and oral) and organizational skills. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Chief Financial Officer and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead a team of auditors and the audit plan for companywide fiscal and operational audit projects Manage engagements, including planning, staffing, fieldwork, and reporting Work with accounting, finance, legal, audit, information technology, and other specialists throughout the company on complex accounting and audit areas including revenue, technical accounting and reporting, and other related topics Ensure audit projects are within the standards under Generally Accepted Auditing Standards (GAAS), Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) auditing standards, and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Develop risk-based audit procedures and test financial statement balances Assist with financial reporting for GAAP and non-GAAP disclosures Perform tracking for audit engagements and timely communications of the results Interact directly with senior management throughout the company to coordinate audit activities Coordinate with other audit teams on the annual testing plan and provide support to them to ensure timely and smooth completion of projects Assist with special projects at the request of the Audit Committee or CFO Assist with the company’s risk assessment projects, regulatory compliance initiatives, and audits What you bring Basic 15+ years of experience in External Audit (Big 4 audit firms highly preferred); experience with similar audit/technical accounting/financial reporting roles in large, accelerated filers 8+ years of experience leading the internal audit function within a growth company A BA/BS degree in Audit, Accounting, Finance or related field required An appropriate certification in accounting and/or auditing - Chartered Accountant (CA), Certified Public Accountant (CPA) Strong knowledge of US GAAP/non-GAAP standards and reporting, GAAS, AICPA, and PCAOB auditing standards, and Sarbanes-Oxley Oracle ERP and Salesforce system knowledge Travel expectations: 10% - This position may require national or international travel Preferred SaaS industry experience Master’s degree or higher Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Excellent project management, communication, influencing and problem-solving skills Ability to influence cross functional teams utilizing different skill sets and perspectives, prioritizing team objectives and managing scope, managing and reconciling conflicting team member opinions Demonstrated action orientation in using creative approaches, utilizing tools, peers, and political savvy to overcome roadblocks Strong interpersonal, presentation, written and verbal communication, and influencing skills Ability to convey a strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex business problems Ability to work effectively under pressure This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. lifecycle Assist control owners with root cause analysis and action plan recommendations Partner cross functionally and with third party vendors to analyze data and make recommendations to support required reporting including: Affirmative Action, EEO, DOL poster requirements Support International People team compliance needs and partner with local compliance subject matter experts as needed Oversee and lead compliance-related projects and initiatives and proactively formulate risk mitigation strategies and programs Assist in the development, implementation, and administration of corporate-level policies Ensure we have a strong business continuity plan for the People team Connect with and inspire people to drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple groups with competing priorities Earn trust across a range of levels and disciplines to establish yourself and the team as a trusted partner What you bring Basic 8+ years of HR and compliance experience Experience supporting compliance audit preparation and SOX and security compliance requirements Experience responding to audits, EEO-1 and VETS Reporting and Affirmative Action Planning Experience working with HR data and reports in Workday and Google Suite Preferred HR Credentials (e.g. PHR from the HR Certification Institute) Experience working with tech teams to implement compliance guardrails and mechanisms Experience building cross-functional partnerships and influencing cross-organizational leadership without administrative ownership Experience with Pay Transparency laws and program implementation Demonstrated ability to stay up to date on compliance regulations Demonstrated effectiveness in written and verbal communications to all levels in an organization
