What you'll do DocuSign is looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive MLE to help build industry-leading state of the art solutions. More particularly scaling Docusign AI offering to several languages and international markets as well as building a scalable ML data pipeline.You will be leveraging mining, deep learning, content understanding, document processing and more. You will develop machine learning models that deliver more experiences throughout the DocuSign Agreement Cloud. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of Engineering- Multilingual and is designated Flex. Responsibility Work together with the ML team to perform research, testing and evaluation of existing and emerging NLP/ML/DL methods and technologies that could be effectively applied to contractual/legal in different languages Develop scalable processes and methods for ML data collection and labeling pipelines Drive the design and implementation of necessary components for more scalable processes for labeling data for ML for English and multiple languages Be able to apply NLP techniques in order to maintain and extend the current rule-based, supervised and unsupervised methods Be knowledgeable in and able to apply ML/DL algorithms and technologies to NLP tasks such as Named Entity Recognition, POS tagging, Parsing, Sentiment Analysis, Clustering, text prediction etc. Develop an understanding of the technologies, methods and the architecture within DocuSign product development. Also an understanding of the entire software development end-to-end process as well as the product code and release management process will be essential Understand, assist and improved the existing training maintenance and enrichment process Work within the Machine Learning team to deploy models to production, using existing and emerging machine learning methods and technologies Work closely with Product Management to translate product requirements into robust, customer-agnostic machine learning success metrics What you bring Basic 12+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 8 years related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 5 years of experience; or equivalent experience 8+ years of experience in designing, developing, deploying and monitoring machine learning and deep learning solutions Experience programming in Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, spaCy, scikit-learn, or equivalent machine learning framework Programming in one or more of the following languages: Python, C#, Java, C/C++ Preferred Demonstrated experience developing and deploying sequence-based Deep Learning models Experience in latest NLP big model technologies like GPT2, BERT, XLNet Experience in Computer Vision Experience with Machine Learning Concepts such as Training, Validation, Testing, Precision/Recall, Bias/Variance etc. Experience in extracting, cleansing, and manipulating large, diverse structured and unstructured sets Assist with the development of language agnostic contract clause recognition, including Cyrillic (Russian) and double byte languages such as Japanese, Korean and Chinese This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do As Lead Software Engineer you will be directly responsible for designing, engineering, and delivering the evolution of our Observability platform. Delivering high scale and highly available systems is part of the DocuSign engineering culture and our success in this revolves around our ability to understand how our systems are operating at all times and where we need to invest in to harden and improve them. We build complex distributed systems and our ability to do this successfully is dependent on the platforms and software you will build. Our ‘livesite' is the lifeblood of our engineering organization and the tooling you will work on ensures we can deliver on our commitments to customers. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign's Service Protection team is focused on anti-abuse and anti-fraud strategies to protect both our customers and our infrastructure against attack. The ideal candidate will have experience working on high scale distributed systems in a service-oriented data center. The team will be part of the core DocuSign platform and will build technology to help identify and block suspicious behaviors around our platform, applications and services. Our team is looking for a talented individual with a passion for customer and infrastructure security. You will be helping define the vision and approach to fighting bots, spam, fraud and denial of service attacks against our systems. The threat environment is always changing. This position will demand critical thinking skills and desire to analyze the patterns of the abusers and turn that analysis into systems that can evaluate the risks in real-time. Your background will show that it involves strategy, delivery, and implementation in past roles. DocuSign is a global company, so a successful candidate will have the ability to work across different teams and different geographies. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Think about how to solve problems in scale and build fault tolerant systems Develop high-quality, ship-ready code that is covered by a full test suite Design and develop user interfaces and core functionality to allow internal and third-party developers to more easily integrate applications with DocuSign Work with Product Management and other developers to understand and translate marketing requirements into design requirements and provide estimates for development Be involved with the design, not just code to a spec Work as part of a cross-site development team to drive design, implementation, testing and release of products What you bring Basic Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, Informatics or equivalent 12+ years development experience Experience working with C#, Go, Java or other modern programming languages Preferred Strong organizational, problem-solving and communication skills Directly involved in the design and operation of large-scale cloud services Experience working in the anti-abuse or anti-fraud engineering spaces Experience in high-scale distributed systems and fault tolerant design Experience building/consuming RESTful web-services Passion for working on a highly available site Experience with evaluating, deploying, and monitoring machine learning solutions in a production environment Experience with applied statistics in a time series context, including predictive methods Agile and Test-driven development methodologies Experience with the entire software development lifecycle, including version control (git), build process, testing, and code release Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-moving environment, prioritize your work and manage your own time A passion to learn new software technologies This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is looking for a seasoned Senior software engineer to join our infrastructure team focused on building scalable, highly available, fault-tolerant, reliable distributed storage systems. The Storage team at DocuSign develops critical back-end services from the ground-up that service hundreds of thousands of transactions per second, with millisecond response times measured in the single digits. We designed and implemented solutions for everything from BLOB, RDBMS, NoSQL, to message queueing, and more. Our team also runs the telemetry, alerting, dashboard reporting of operational health of the docusign product lines. We are tackling the challenge of ensuring our in-house storage solutions will scale to the next 10X+, while in parallel making sure the needs of our internal customers are met, as the company executes against our Agreement Cloud vision. We are the backbone powering the digital signature revolutions, moving at fast pace, solving hard problems, and continuously innovating in the space and raising the bar. If you share our passion and excitement building robust distributed systems, this is the team for you. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Manager, Market Development will possess the ability to manage & motivate a team of Market Development Representatives (MDR) to achieve individual opportunity generation quotas. They also must be able to measure, monitor and hold MDRs accountable for their activities and results as well as lead by example. The Manager, Market Development will work directly with MDRs to improve cold calling, qualification and discovery calls, prospecting sequences, appointment setting, follow up, organization, and overall prospecting effectiveness. He/she will work with the Senior Manager of Market Development to increase efficiencies and processes within the department. This Manager will mentor each MDR individually while also building a strong, cohesive, collaborative team that is responsible for supplying qualified leads to DocuSign Account Executives. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Director of Market Development and is designated Flex. Responsibility Manage and motivate a team of Market Development Representatives (MDR) to achieve individual opportunity generation quotas Measure, monitor and hold MDRs accountable for their activities and results as well as lead by example Work directly with MDRs to improve calling, qualification and discovery calls, prospecting sequences, appointment setting, follow up, organization, and overall prospecting effectiveness Work with the leader of the Market Development team to increase efficiencies and processes within the department Mentor each MDR individually while also building a strong, cohesive, collaborative team that is responsible for supplying qualified leads to DocuSign Account Executives What you bring Basic BA/BS in a business or a technical related field of study 1+ years of management experience with specific experience in selling software in a similar SaaS based company AND/OR 3+ years prior experience selling software in a quota-carrying role Preferred Quota-attainment record of meeting and/or exceeding targets by managing process for identifying, qualifying, and closing new business as well as and not limited to growing an existing install base Prior experience developing and maintaining business, sales, and vertical market plans as well as negotiating and closing complex deal Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing team Experience selling into a variety of industries and territories as well as experience cultivating larger, strategic relationships key Capacity to work on cross-functional projects and teams as needed as well as leverage internal resources to problem-solve Strong verbal and written communication skills – includes excellent reporting (CRM) and forecasting skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Marketing Analytics Director is a key member of our GTM Strategy team, responsible for driving growth by optimizing our demand generation engine. In this role you will be the eyes and ears into our demand funnel, measuring and monitoring Marketing’s performance in creating leads and converting those leads into customers. You will serve as a business partner to our Marketing team, helping to ensure we get the most out of the demand budget. Your insights will identify growth levers to increase demand and operational improvements to scale the business. You will help shape the long-term growth of the company through annual and quarterly planning and ongoing performance reviews, working cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Sales Ops, and FP&A. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP, Marketing Strategy and Planning and is designated Flex. Responsibility Partner with Marketing leadership to drive the business forward Identify key opportunities to improve our demand gen engine through analytics, quantitative insights, and good business sense Understand the intersection points between Marketing and Sales, and become the go-to expert Architect SQL queries leveraging data from Salesforce, Eloqua, and additional data sources that capture DocuSign’s complex business model Represent Marketing in cross-functional forums, such as pipeline councils and planning meetings Lead Marketing through our annual and quarterly planning process in partnership with Sales, Sales, Ops, and FP&A Assist with ad hoc requests and projects from the Marketing organization What you bring Basic 12+ years of experience in Strategy, Marketing Analytics, or Sales Strategy roles Fluent in SQL, with knowledge of relational databases and data warehouses Experience analyzing large datasets BA/BS degree in a business/quantitative field Preferred MBA or other advanced degree Exceptional problem-solving and communication skills Understanding of a commercial Marketing demand generation funnel Proven track-record in fast growing B2B SaaS companies This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do The Partner Development Representative (PDR) will co-sell with internal and external partner Account Executives to secure sufficient flow of qualified partner opportunities for DocuSign account executives. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is growing fast, and we are looking for people to join our high-performance team who are excited to make a difference and help where needed. The Enterprise Solutions Consultant works alongside the Enterprise Public Sector sales team to discover and understand complex customer business problems and requirements in order to translate and create a solution leveraging DocuSign’s platform for the Federal industry. This role seeks to illustrate the value and benefits of the DocuSign offering via an engaging story. Applicants in Washington, D.C. metro area are preferred. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of Solution Engineering – Public Sector, and is designated Remote. Responsibility Collaborate with the Enterprise field sales team to cultivate and secure net-new business within an assigned territory and targeted accounts Uncover, comprehend, and document complex business challenges, processes, and enterprise architecture Engage in meaningful business and technical conversations, sharing industry insights with key stakeholders from all levels and business units within large enterprise organizations Establish technical credibility and build confidence in recommended solutions leveraging your product expertise, custom product demonstrations, technical Q&A, business process diagrams, and product roadmap discussions Articulate selected recommendations and the business value they provide to diverse audiences Work collaboratively with sales partners and other internal teams to provide a world class buying experience Understand the Contract Lifecycle Management space Demo and sell based on value selling methodologies defined by the company What you bring Basic 8+ years prior experience within a Public Sector pre-sales role selling SaaS solutions and concepts to Federal customers BS/BA degree or equivalent in relevant work experience Preferred 12+ years prior pre-sales experience within a mid-market to enterprise level SaaS offering, ideally cloud-based Proficient in delivering software demonstrations in-person and virtually Experience with technical business documentation like workflow diagrams, proposals, SOWs, RFPs and RFIs, etc. Proven experience working with employees at all levels of an organization Familiarity with Enterprise-class software systems like ERP, CRM, and ECM systems Familiarity with system integration methods such as web services, SOAP APIs & REST APIs Familiarity with web-based solutions, website development, HTML, XML, and structured data Familiarity with electronic signature concepts Strong verbal and written communication skills Willingness to travel 45% or more as needed Resides in Washington, D.C. metro area This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $117,400 - $178,975 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $130,300 - $184,000 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The DocuSign AI team builds Machine Learning solutions that power insights and automation for the entire DocuSign Agreement Cloud. We have built industry-leading Document AI products and features, all leveraging an enormous wealth of text and image data and deep computer vision and natural language models. Our group is pioneering the Smart Agreement Cloud of the future and we’re looking for experienced, driven, and diverse industry experts who want to be part of building that future together. No matter who our customer is, where they do business, or what they’re agreeing on, our team would like to simplify and optimize their business processes around contract negotiation, execution, and post-signature analysis. Our ultimate goal is to make the world more agreeable by empowering all of our customers with automated expertise. We’re looking for passionate and talented engineers to build out the machine learning platform and infrastructure that will power DocuSign’s Agreement Cloud. You will help support all aspects of the machine learning lifecycle, including the research platform, training and deployment systems, and scalable serving infrastructure. Our team is responsible for building a platform that supports an international team of machine learning engineers and data scientists and can serve AI solutions to DocuSign at scale. This role will be a part of the Foundations Machine Learning team at DocuSign, which builds analytics products that utilize AI, machine learning, and cutting-edge CV/NLP deep learning based models to provide insights for the DocuSign Agreement Cloud. Our team is distributed across the Bay Area, Seattle, Europe, and Egypt and you will be working collaboratively across these teams. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Engineering Director and is designated Flex. Responsibility Think about how to build distributed systems at scale with enterprise-grade security and reliability Drive testing, releases, and monitoring of machine learning based products Write high quality, shippable code across the stack that is easy to maintain and test Collaborate with Applied Science and Product teams to ensure successful and timely delivery of new machine learning products and features Work collaboratively across different time zones and geographies Develop highly scalable and reliable machine learning infrastructure that can perform model training and evaluation Build vital tools and infrastructure to monitor and understand the performance of complex systems What you bring Basic 15+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 12 years related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 8 years of experience; or equivalent experience Experience building/consuming RESTful and gRPC based web-services Experience with CI/CD build pipelines, integrated tests, and test-driven development Familiarity with cloud deployment technologies, such as Kubernetes or Docker containers Experience with designing and scaling fullstack or distributed backend systems Experience with building carrier grade availability services Preferred Ideal candidates have past experience building machine learning products, data pipelines, or machine learning training and deployment systems. Experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models Ability and desire to move across technology stacks fluently and easily This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As a Principal Product Manager, you are a highly motivated leader who is accountable for defining the finance data product vision, designing solutions that build trust and developing a capability roadmap to scale and accelerate business decisions. You will also act as a data steward for SaaS internal and external financial metrics and partner closely with finance business owners. You are accountable for developing policy, improving quality, and driving adoption and usage of data products in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. You will partner closely with business strategy leaders, clarify strategic intentions, identify business outcomes, and develop a data capability roadmap. With your knowledge in both data and business, you will deliver in-depth insights and recommendations to decision-makers. You are driven and a self-starter with demonstrated experience in high-growth, fast-paced organizations. You have excellent written and oral communication skills, analytics and consultative skills, and stakeholder engagement skills. You build out the data story that helps our executives to understand the opportunities and accelerate the decisions. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to Sr. Director, Data Product Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Account for product vision, strategy and roadmap of finance data products Understand business strategy by collaborating with finance and other business units Analyze business models and regional nuances to support global business Define financial metrics definitions for internal operations Help define and drive policies to improve data quality and build trust in data Lead decisions independently that significantly influence the product strategies and roadmap Align cross functional stakeholders on the roadmap Create product requirements and partner with data delivery teams Develop adoption and change management to drive adoption and usage Communicate regularly with senior management and executives on product performance and roadmap Drive success of the company’s goals and objectives through financial data Craft and deliver products demonstrations Forecast and manage budget to develop new features and ongoing product support Play a leadership role in mentoring and coaching Data Analysts and Engineers Model leadership behaviors for others to emulate during times of ambiguity and change What you bring Basic 15+ years of finance experience in transforming business with data 5+ experience with SaaS business operations and leading change management Experience developing concepts and theories by connecting data across business domains Business acumen with experience communicating the data story Preferred Experience in Tableau or other visualization tools Experience in Oracle ERP This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do We are looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join the Sign engineering team and help scale and build the next generation of e-Sign experiences. As a Principal Engineer you will spearhead the architecture and development of a highly scalable, reliable and available (“5 nines”) piece of our core offering. You will cover API/backend, from sending a document to signing to integrating with various 3rd party systems, all in a dynamic environment with a 24x7x52 critical service and an exceptional team. Our team focuses on distributed decision making that rewards ownership, transparency, and collaboration. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Write high quality code that is easy to maintain and test Build TypeScript and JavaScript client code using modern web frameworks and technologies (React + Redux + Sass) Work with UX and Design to standardize and simplify UI development practices Build modular/reusable UI components Build and maintain front-end web application infrastructure Participate in the entire development life cycle, from concept to release Support strategic code sharing and architecture for one or more functional area Ensure design and architecture is extensible across multiple projects, and participate in technical design and code reviews Work with Product Management and other developers to understand design requirements and provide estimates for development Work closely with QA to identify test cases and devise efficient, scalable testing processes Work cooperatively with product management and design to create features that are scalable and secure. identify, propose, and implement process improvements to continuously increase the team's productivity and efficiency Stay current with the latest development best practices and share your findings with the team Work as part of a cross-site development team to drive design, implementation, testing, and release of products Raise issues proactively that might impact delivery commitments Research new features and technologies Fix production issues and maintain the code as needed What you bring Basic 15+ years software development experience 10+ years web application development Experience with modern web application technologies (TypeScript, ES6, React/Angular/VueJS, Sass/Less, etc.) BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent industry experience Preferred Previous experience building design and component libraries 5+ years’ experience implementing responsive designs for mobile, tablet, and desktop 5+ years’ experience building SaaS web applications 2+ years’ experience with web accessibility standards and practices Prior experience aligning platform architecture with security and data Experience with unit testing frameworks Experience developing, promoting and building consensus across engineering teams Understanding of web application design principles such as usability, performance, and security Problem solving and troubleshooting skills Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with frequent production releases Excellent written and verbal communication skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $185,400 - $261,900 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As a Product Designer, you will design elegant, customer-focused web and/or mobile applications for millions of DocuSign users around the globe. You will be responsible for the user interface, its architecture, interaction, user research and visual design across platforms. You are a talented, passionate, efficient designer with strong analytic skills and an inventive storyteller. You collaborate with colleagues with ease and bring cross-functional teams together around a common vision. You welcome feedback from a wide variety of stakeholders and research ideas, and tap into your intuition to make the right decision in the absence of definitive facts. You adeptly balance business needs with simple, engaging, user-centered solutions. You are adept at working in an Agile or Scrum product development environment that is cross-functional and highly collaborative. This position is an individual contributor reporting to Sr. Manager, Product Design and is designated Flex. Responsibility Champion the design, pushing yourself to explore big ideas before narrowing in on feasible, inventive solutions and honing in on the small details Partner with product management, engineering, user research and tech writers to define multiple product features, owning the design execution with support from senior designers Participate in and help run cross-functional design thinking workshops Produce deliverables for every stage of the design process, including storyboards, wireframes, user flows, interactive prototypes, and pixel perfect visual assets for web and mobile Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As the Principal Product Manager - Product Led Growth, you will lead the efforts to develop the roadmap, vision, and priorities for DocuSign’s business-facing eSignature applications which are used by millions of business users worldwide. You will be a champion of customers and consumers alike. Based on qualitative and quantitative insights, you will inform product directions that drive measurable impact. You will leverage innovative technologies (e.g., AI/ML) to deliver impactful innovations that drive top-level business outcomes and redefine the “state-of-the-art” for the eSignature industry. You will manage a team of highly motivated individuals and support their continued career growth. You will champion a product management culture that focuses on delivering impact, data-driven decision making and fast yet diligent execution. Product Managers at DocuSign are the CEOs of their product and ship features that make our customers successful. PMs work cross-functionally with customers, Sales, Marketing, Engineering, UX, Support, etc. to define product vision, gather requirements, execute on the feature and drive product launches. As a data-driven, customer obsessed Principal Product Manager, Growth - your primary responsibility will be to accelerate growth at every stage of the product experience, such as improving product activation, streamlining onboarding experiences, driving new feature adoption, ongoing engagement and retention, and converting free users to paid and upselling existing customers. You will have a dedicated team of full stack engineers, designers, and data scientists (engineers, developers, analysts, marketers) to improve the end to end user experience, optimize the customer’s journey through our growth loops, identify opportunities to improve customer acquisition and retention, and drive a world class product growth team. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Sr. Director of Product Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead the strategy and roadmap for eSignature applications with clear focus on driving business results Attract, manage, and develop a talented, diverse, equitable and inclusive team of product managers Apply your understanding of both business and consumer audiences to drive the next generation of eSignature innovations Understand market and customer needs by closely working with Customers, Consumers, User Research, Data Science, and Marketing Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products Monitor, measure and report on key business and customer metrics. Identify areas for continuous testing and optimization. Define hypotheses for experiments and execute accordingly Prioritize opportunities, define requirements and execute cross-functionally (Engineering, Design, Data Science, User Research, etc.) to take features from concept to launch Collaborate with Engineering, Marketing, Pricing, Legal, UX, and other cross-functional teams Lead the product strategy, roadmap delivery, and growth impact for Onboarding, Engagement, Signer, and Virality What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience in Product Management 15+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 12+ years related experience with a Master’s degree 2+ years of experience hiring, managing, and developing product managers Critical thinking and analytical leadership experience Experience presenting to senior executive audiences Bachelor’s degree Preferred Proven track record of innovation and scaling products from 0 to 1, 1 to 100 and so on Experience building with two-sided products Master’s degree Experience with consumer and/or B2B new user onboarding; SaaS business with freemium / trial motion is strongly preferred Strong knowledge of owning and executing well-defined AB tests Effective communicator both in writing and public speaking/ presentations - must enroll sr leadership and convey impact of investments. Must rally cross functional product development teams to have a high level of ownership over the customer experience and results. Must manage stakeholder expectations and communicate roadmap deliver for competing priorities This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $165,600 - $233,850 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $178,300 - $251,875 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. What you'll do The Program Manager, Sign will lead and motivate our teams by introducing efficient processes, driving innovative and measurable solutions to maximize efficiency for team members, and working in unison with the product development teams to create the best experiences for our customers. This role will be responsible for managing programs’ scope through all phases of the life cycle. The Program Manager, Sign will build schedules, monitoring the project from initiation through delivery, organizing the interdepartmental activities, ensuring management of interdependencies and managing risks proactively to drive completion of the program. This person will plan, track and monitor work of cross functional teams including but not limited to product management, Engineering, Marketing, Field Enablement, Customer Enablement and program staff, providing technical support and direction. Duties and tasks are varied, needing independent judgment so this person needs to be well experienced in the area of program management expertise. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager, Program Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Work with development teams to determine realistic schedules to launch new products and features Communicate schedules, dependencies, issues, and risks across teams and to stakeholders Coach teams on agile practices when necessary including stepping in as Scrum Master while training the teams Keep the Sign executive and business teams updated on project timelines and results Partner with end-to-end implementation teams to define launch plans to identify and mitigate gaps, risks, and dependencies Define communication plans for programs Lead communication within the team, across Product Development and DocuSign Ensure adherence to governance processes and visibility to release management Identify and track risks to delivery and overall program schedule Evaluate existing processes and procedures Make recommendations and drive process improvement and adoption of best practices to improve efficiency and effectiveness Manage teams across disciplines and geographies Travel up to 10% of the year What you bring Basic 5+ years leading complex, cross-functional, global programs for SaaS based products Proficient using Smartsheets, project organization tools, Atlassian Toolset, Jira, Confluence, Portfolio and Advanced Reporting Preferred Confident in working with executive team members as well as working with implementation teams Skilled at dealing with ambiguity in a rapidly growing and changing environment Experience in companies in both small and large scale software development organizations Strong business acumen and technical background, with the ability to quickly understand and communicate technical concepts and challenges across wide-ranging audiences Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and expectations Ability to successfully collaborate with multiple functions across the organization Experience building strong cross-team relationships and partnerships This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Proposal Writer is responsible for proposal development, including creating and maintaining schedules, organizing resources, coordinating inputs and reviews, ensuring alignment with bid strategy, ensuring compliance, resolving internal response team issues, and providing process leadership for the completion and on-time submission of RFx responses (Request for Proposal (RFP), Request for Quotation (RFQ), and Request for Information (RFI)) and Security Assessments. Ultimately, the Proposal Writer manages the RFx response from beginning to end: from research and data collection and maintenance, to writing, editing and proofreading, to proposal document creation and revision, and production (when needed). The role includes continuous review and knowledge of the DocuSign solutions, content updates in Loopio, and security-related questions and responses. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager, Proposal Management and is designated as Flex. Responsibility Own RFx or Security Assessment responses within the Proposal Writer’s alignment or as assigned by the Manager, Proposal Management Plan, research, develop and edit complex content for proposals in response to customer solicitations, maintaining high standards around the quality and accuracy of the final output Serve as a central point of contact on assigned proposals and leads a multi-discipline or cross-functional team Lead the bid/no bid qualification process with Sales and Solution Engineering, using data collected Review RFx for flags, issues, and risks, and work with internal teams to mitigate these risks Act as the visionary for the solution, identifying and developing win themes and strategies based on the latest competitive intel Create the project plan and track assignments for completion Lead initial and ongoing status meetings to review progress on outstanding RFx content tasks and assignments Write content for cover letters, executive summaries, and other materials to customize for the customer Help to maintain proposal processes, templates, standards, and best practices within the Proposal Knowledge Center, providing suggestions and improvements as needed Develop and maintain proposal content in Loopio Identify content gaps, then work with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) - sales, technical, and engineering experts, as well as contract and legal representatives - to craft responses Manage involvement of SME for technical writing assignments, ensuring that submissions are accurate, compliant with the outline and RFP instructions, and address win themes and strategies Track RFx responses in Salesforce and keep information updated throughout the project and following submission Keep management informed of progress and/or issues and provide inputs for monthly and quarterly reporting What you bring Basic 2+ years of proposal experience in technology sales BS/BA degree or equivalent experience Preferred 5+ years of proposal experience within a software sales environment Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills Excellent writing, grammar, and spelling abilities Technical writing skills Proficiency with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides) Skilled in engaging with senior technical staff and upper-level management to obtain necessary information Self-starter, multitasker, team player, works well under pressure, and follows through on tasks Skilled in handling multiple deadlines simultaneously and working independently Good attention to detail Willingness to travel a few times a year for team events This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Enterprise Account Executive cultivates and closes new Enterprise-level relationships, specifically within the Southeast region, quarterbacking deals from start to finish. This role will be a hybrid of net-new relationships and existing growth within targeted accounts. The ideal candidate will be curious by nature, a strategic hunter, and possess strong relationship-building skills. You'll work for the company who created the industry leading Agreement Cloud which incorporates our eSignature products into a larger automation platform. Our solution does what legacy systems can’t: it streamlines your contract lifecycle, enhances your customer experience and brings everyone together, online. You’ll sell products that you believe in; you’ll help introduce change to the way your customers live and work; you’ll work with competitive commission and stock plan structures that reward your efforts; and you’ll experience career growth and opportunity based on personal achievement. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Regional VP of Sales, Enterprise and is designated Flex. Responsibility Drive success of the company’s goals and objectives through achieving individual sales quotas Qualify sales opportunities based on DocuSign’s sales methodology and metrics, to include customer fit and success criteria Identify, cultivate and close on net-new business as well as manage existing relationships to ensure customer renewals and retention Build account plans and strategies for each target account Collaborate and engage internal resources (Senior Executives, Presales, Professional Services, Legal etc.) in Sales Campaigns Uncover needs and develop relationships with multiple stakeholders within the assigned accounts across the Lines of Business, IT, Procurement and Senior Management Forecast sales activity and revenue achievements accurately through proper use of sales tools Travel 25% or more as needed What you bring Basic 8+ years of direct enterprise-level experience in a software sales environment Preferred Resides in Florida 12+ years of enterprise level SaaS sales experience, ideally within cloud-based technology within the assigned territory 5+ years experience selling in Public Sector State and Local Agencies Experience managing large territories Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles, including prior success in closing 1M+ deals and managing multiple large accounts Strong portfolio of C-Level contacts within Enterprise Accounts across a variety of accounts Familiarity with Google suite BS/BA degree or equivalent experience This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $110,000 - $155,375 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. What you'll do The Regional Data Manager focuses on ensuring marketing and sales teams have the required addressable market data to generate demand and revenue. Delivering against this goal will require strong engagement with cross-functional business leaders to deliver against the GTM team's objectives. This role has broad scope and requires some expertise in data management to ensure the volume and quality of the company and people data are sufficient. The Regional Data Manager serves as a trusted advisor to the senior leadership team and as a critical business lead for cross-functional projects involving company and person data. This role requires working across the business to prioritize, scope and lead data quality projects.The ideal candidate will be able to proactively assess regional data quality, deliver key insights in a compelling way and lead the evaluation and use of new data sources. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager of GTM Intelligence and is designated Flex. Responsibility Build strong partnerships across departments and serve as a trusted advisor Deliver data-informed recommendations to senior leaders to improve data quality and ensure strategy alignment Scope and manage projects to improve regional data quality Measure and publish the impact of company data acquisition/enrichment efforts or quality initiatives to the broader organization Publish metrics that assess the completeness, accuracy, and utility of company and person data in region, which may include data visualizations, dashboards, and reports Serve as the primary contact for external data vendors, including assessing performance and adapting to changing business needs Leverage bulk API tools to merge duplicates, match records to a 3rd party source, insert new records, update existing records or delete records What you bring Basic Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or other quantitative focus 5+ years of analytical and project management experience Experience analyzing data and interpreting trends Preferred 5+ years of analytical and project management experience in consulting, sales operations or marketing operations Basic SQL skills and experience with relational databases Proficiency in data operations with experience transforming data using Excel or Google Sheets Experience managing firmographic and/or demographic data Experience with Salesforce Exposure to agile and JIRA Proficient in data visualization tools such Tableau Using bulk API tools to manage data en mass Results-driven, self-motivated, and able to work independently Exposure to high-growth work environments Understanding of SaaS business model Proven track record of successfully managing project scope, risks, and issues for executive awareness, escalation, and decision making Strong organizational skills with ability to influence and manage through ambiguity Ability to manage multiple stakeholders, priorities and expectations Effective, clear, and concise verbal and written communication skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. jobTitle: Regional Vice President, Small to Medium Business
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Regional Vice President manages and motivates a team of Account Executives (AEs) to achieve individual sales quotas where targets will be prospects within the vertical or geography. This sales leader will measure, monitor and hold AEs accountable for their activities and results as well as lead by example. They are also required to assist in making account calls with AEs, assist in account health monitoring, and effectively maintain DocuSign's value within accounts as well as deliver and coach sales demos via Zoom Meeting tool. This leader will mentor each AE individually while also building a strong cohesive, collaborative team. They will also be responsible for monitoring forecasting efforts and delivering on quota. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Area Vice President, Commercial Sales and is designated Flex. Responsibility Manage a sales team daily in order to grow overall revenue of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud offering through attainment of monthly quotas Assess sales pipeline, activity and forecasts to determine sales progress & areas for refinement/improvement Coach AEs through the development of key sales skills, including vertical market management, forecasting and sales planning, prospecting and pipelining within account base, complex deal negotiations, cross-functional support both internally and externally, as well as CRM/reporting accuracy; this includes performance management, creating a bench of qualified talent, and growing the team headcount as needed. Develop proven and new strategies with AEs to further penetrate accounts and reinforce process and steps designed to deliver value at enterprise scale to DocuSign customers Maintain positive and proactive line of communication between the lines of business as well as senior leadership; includes developing and delivering accurate forecast and attainment details during weekly and quarterly business reviews Identify and support opportunities for training as well as career diversification and growth across the team Operate well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment without requiring significant supervision. Can think creatively and independently to resolve conflict as well as solve problems What you bring Basic 5+ years prior experience selling software in a B2B quota-carrying role BA/BS Degree Preferred 2+ years of prior leadership experience managing sales teams within software, ideally SaaS-based offerings (both on-premise and Cloud) 7+ years experience selling software in a quota-carrying role Quota-attainment record of meeting and/or exceeding targets by managing process for identifying, qualifying, & closing new business as well as and not limited to growing an existing install base Prior experience developing and maintaining business, sales, & market plans as well as negotiating & closing complex deal Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing team Prior experience selling an eSignature or Agreement or Document solution also helpful Experience selling into a variety of industries and territories as well as experience cultivating larger, strategic relationships key Capacity to work on cross-functional projects and teams as needed as well as leverage internal resources to problem-solve Strong verbal and written communication skills – includes excellent reporting and forecasting skills. Attention to detail is critical Willingness to travel 40% or more as needed This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The DocuSign Renewal Manager (RM) is a high-impact position, responsible for owning and executing a portfolio of renewal contracts in an assigned territory. The ideal RM is an experienced professional with a full understanding of the SaaS contracting space. They will resolve a wide range of issues in creative ways. They are responsible for minimizing financial attrition, locking in favorable terms with our clients, identifying growth and providing insights to the business that improve future outcomes. Renewal managers are responsible for ensuring maximum financial results for DocuSign while strengthening partnerships with existing customers. This position is an individual contributor reporting to Sr. Manager - Renewal Management and is designated Flex Responsibility Own and execute win/win negotiation strategies for a high quantity of renewals that maximize contract value while protecting and enhancing customer trust Maximize account growth by playing a role on the account team and helping to identify incremental opportunities upon resolution strategies Collaborate with internal resources such as account executives, customer success, pricing, legal, revenue operations and product management to develop strategies for upcoming Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As a Go To Market (GTM) Strategy & Operations Business Partner, you will work on topics that range from transformational GTM strategy to the nuts and bolts of GTM operations. You will do this through a combination of analytical insight, strong business acumen, and robust cross-functional partnerships with leaders in Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Finance, HR, etc. In this role, you will be the business partner to senior GTM Compensation, and GTM leaders. You will work closely with the previously mentioned functions and cross functional teams to innovate and drive strategic initiatives to scale our operational processes and support our GTM strategy. Why should you be excited about this role? You enjoy driving change in a business and seeing fast results. You are a hard but efficient worker and are able to balance competing priorities. You have high aspirations and you are excited to scale a business from $2B to $5B revenue! This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director, GTM Strategy & Operations and is designated Flex. Responsibility Represent the GTM Field roles for operational processes related to SPIFFs, President’s Club, Ramp Analysis, and other GTM Compensation processes Partner with Go To Market (GTM) teams, GTM Strategy, Planning & Ops, and Productivity & Intelligence to identify, prioritize, and deliver on operational process improvements Drive rhythm of the business activities, including quarterly business reviews, coordinating annual planning, retrospectives, and roadmaps for GTM Compensation Advise senior members of the GTM organization on growing and optimizing their businesses by making data-driven, actionable recommendations that help them achieve their long-term strategic priorities Track productivity drivers, trends and operating metrics and provide insights and recommendations Conceptualize and execute projects to improve our Go To Market engine Establish strong working relationships with peers and cross functional teams to achieve objectives Prepare presentations and communicate findings from initiatives to management and broader organization Become the go to expert on the operational process of GTM Compensation What you bring Basic 8+ years of top-notch analytics experience in management consulting, investment banking, or corporate analytical roles BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience Preferred Experience working closely with senior GTM leaders, prior exposure to high-growth work environments, and a strong understanding of SaaS business models and GTM principles are all highly desirable Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, navigate challenging data sets, develop solutions, and craft high-quality executive presentations Effective, clear, and concise verbal and written communication skills Results driven, self-motivated, and able to work independently High degree of intellectual curiosity Sales and analytics systems knowledge within the SaaS industry, particularly Xactly and Tableau This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do Sales Development Representative (French Bilingual) As the Sales Development Representative (SDR), you make outbound calls to potential clients who have expressed interest in learning more about DocuSign or appear to be strong potential customers based upon our general market focus. You qualify prospective customers through targeted questions about their business strategy then leveraging this information to align and sell DocuSign’s product offerings. You spend roughly 80% of the time on the phone prospecting new clients. You receive hands-on training with an emphasis on strategic selling and a focus on researching targeted accounts. You are in a great position to gain in-depth experience in a rapidly growing SaaS company. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to Manager, Sales Development and is designated Flex. Responsibility Make outbound calls to prospects who have expressed interest in learning more about DocuSign Make outbound calls to prospects who are deemed to reside in one of DocuSign’s core vertical markets Share information about DocuSign and ask questions about the prospect's business intentions Discern propensity to buy and forward good potential leads to the Sales Account Executives to pursue Schedule appointments between prospects and Account Executives Record prospect information in CRM database What you bring Basic BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience Fluent in French and English both speaking and writing Preferred Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to ask questions, gather information and formulate an action plan to connect business needs to solutions Ability to multitask, prioritize, take initiative and manage time effectively Strong problem-solving skills Experience with quotas and metrics in past positions Motivated, driven and self-starting attitude Familiar with Google suite This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive Applied Scientist to help build industry-leading state of the art solutions. You will be leveraging, mining, deep learning, content understanding, document processing and more. You will prototype machine learning models that deliver more personalized and automated customer experiences throughout the DocuSign Agreement Cloud. This position is an Individual Contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, Engineering – DocuSign AI and is designated Flex. Responsibility Work together with the Machine Learning team to perform research, testing and evaluation of existing and emerging NLP/ML/DL methods and technologies that could be effectively applied to contractual and legal requirements Be knowledgeable in and be able to apply NLP techniques in order to maintain and extend the current rule-based, supervised and unsupervised methods Be knowledgeable in and able to apply ML/DL algorithms and technologies to NLP tasks such as Named Entity Recognition, POS tagging, Parsing, Sentiment Analysis, Clustering, text prediction etc. Develop an understanding of the technologies, methods and the architecture within DocuSign product development Understand the entire software development end-to-end process as well as the product code and release management process Understand, assist and improve the existing training, maintenance and enrichment processes Work within the Machine Learning team to deploy models to production using existing and emerging machine learning methods and technologies Work with Product Management to translate product requirements into robust, customer-agnostic machine learning success metrics What you bring Basic 8+ years' of experience in designing, developing, deploying and monitoring machine learning and deep learning solutions Experience programming in Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, spaCy, Scikit-learn, or equivalent machine learning framework Experience programming in one or more of the following languages: Python, C#, Java, C/C++ Bachelor’s degree in computer science, physics, statistics, econometrics, operations research, applied mathematics or an equal computational field Preferred Demonstrated experience developing and deploying sequence-based Deep Learning models Experience in latest NLP big model technologies like GPT2, BERT, XLNet Experience in Computer Vision Experience with Machine Learning Concepts such as Training, Validation, Testing, Precision/Recall, Bias/Variance etc. Experience in extracting, cleansing and manipulating large, diverse structured and unstructured sets Experience with the development of language agnostic contract clause recognition, including Cyrillic (Russian) and double byte languages such as Japanese, Korean and Chinese This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $130,800 - $184,800 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign's Data Science team is looking for a Sr. Data Engineer to lead the development of key data products and capabilities to enable data-driven product development and decision making. In this role, you will help build the Data Science and Machine Learning (ML) Platform and Architecture, to support the Data Scientists to explore, evaluate, and mine new data sets for important information and insights into the execution and performance of our product and product engineering teams against company goals. You will also build data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data from and to a myriad of data systems within DocuSign. You will learn about the problems and needs our teams have and will be asked to build, plan, execute, and automate a keystone project to identify and address one of those needs or problems. To excel in this role, you will need to have an excellent understanding of modern, cloud-based big data and ML architectures. Prior experience writing high-performance SQL, Hadoop/Spark, and Python is a must-have. If you are an experienced data engineer and passionate about building products, platforms, and capabilities that enable a culture of test & learn, and data-driven product development, then this could be a great role for you. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Science Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Create data pipelines that massage and transform massive amounts of structured and unstructured data Establish quality of data by programmatically analyzing incoming partitions and recording metrics in a database Architect data models that join multiple data sources into a model that can be efficiently used by-product data scientists as well as marketing analysts Enhance data model by creating derived data - for example, you will be responsible for creating sessions from time-series data, and for joining unauthenticated and authenticated sessions Architect and build the Data Science and Machine Learning platform and environment for the data science team to explore and access data, build, train, and productionize data science models, and easily share analysis Peer-review code and participate in architecture reviews Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, and metadata What you bring Basic 8+ of experience as a Data Engineer enabling technology product development Bachelor’s degree in either Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field Software Development experience in at least one object-oriented language (Python, Java, etc.) Experience writing advanced SQL to extract, transform and load data sets Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets Experience in modeling, managing, scaling, and performance tuning of high volume OLTP, OLAP, and data warehouse environments Experience with data management systems, practices, and standards Knowledge and experience in agile/scrum product development Preferred Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong at data engineering tasks in Python specifically with expressing common parsing and manipulation tasks in the language Excellent understanding of cloud infrastructure as well as experience in building big data applications and platforms in AWS, Azure, GCP Experience with Azure Data Explorer, Snowflake, DBT and Airflow Strong knowledge and expertise in NoSQL technologies including columnar, time series, and in-memory databases Proficient with Hadoop and data visualization tools Proven track record of architecting and building large scale distributed big data products and data-as-a-service Knowledge and expertise in containers (Docker) and container-orchestration systems (Kubernetes) especially for building Data Science or ML platform Self-directed and capable of operating amid ambiguity This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $115,800 - $163,575 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do We are looking for a Senior Engagement Manager to join our Customer Success (CS) team. The CS team is responsible for all elements of customer success, including digital transformation strategy, adoption best practices, implementation services, education and support. The Engagement Management team fulfills the role of trusted advisor to sales and customers, with a deep understanding of end-to-end professional services, training, and deployment of DocuSign Agreement Cloud. They have the ability to understand a customer’s needs, convey steps that customers can take to be successful, recommend best practices in deploying software, and align the right services to promote successful customer outcomes. The Senior Engagement Manager partners closely with the field sales team and supports their deals through the alignment and selling of services. Engagement Managers are the conduit between Sales and Professional Services, ensuring the downstream teams are prepared to support the services that are sold during the sales cycle. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of North America Engagement Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Develop strong relationships with Field Sales, Customers, Professional Services, Customer Success, and Operations to ensure alignment and increase the likelihood of customer success and satisfaction Align to the sales team’s account and deal strategies, engage in the selling cycle, and pitch the appropriate services to support customer outcomes Scope services, propose and recommend approaches to customers, and estimate work effort to develop a Statement of Work Understand the various services and training offerings and what outcomes are achieved when each type of service is leveraged by customers Communicate technical concepts in business or technical terms Partner with Professional Services to ensure appropriate knowledge transfer is conducted once a deal is sold and to support the team when challenges arise Anticipate problems and recommend innovative solutions; achieve customer satisfaction through the sale of sound consulting projects Hit quotas each quarter, as this is a quota-carrying Services Sales role Travel 10-20% What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience in an enterprise level software consulting or services sales Bachelor’s Degree 2+ years of experience as a consultant Preferred Proven track record for attaining and exceeding annual quota Ability to collaborate with sales to build and execute complex account strategies and sales plays Ability to scope and estimate projects and drive contracts and deals to closure Understanding of enterprise development lifecycle (Agile, Hybrid, Waterfall) and ability to communicate the differences between each as well as how projects are managed in each approach Knowledge of SaaS and Cloud-based enterprise software offerings Ability to lead initiatives and support the growth of other Engagement Managers on the team Collaborative and open to support the team on deals, processes, and share skills of how to be most productive as an Engagement Manager Self-starter that initiates their own personal growth through independent learning of DocuSign Agreement Cloud and methods to support customers in digitizing their System of Agreement Excellent team building, verbal, and written communication skills as well as reporting and presentation expertise This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Engagement Managers are the conduit between Sales and Professional Services, ensuring the downstream teams are prepared to support the services that are sold during the sales cycle. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of North America Engagement Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Develop strong relationships with Field Sales, Customers, Professional Services, Customer Success, and Operations to ensure alignment and increase the likelihood of customer success and satisfaction Align to the sales team’s account and deal strategies, engage in the selling cycle, and pitch the appropriate services to support customer outcomes Scope services, propose and recommend approaches to customers, and estimate work effort to develop a Statement of Work Understand the various services and training offerings and what outcomes are achieved when each type of service is leveraged by customers Communicate technical concepts in business or technical terms Partner with Professional Services to ensure appropriate knowledge transfer is conducted once a deal is sold and to support the team when challenges arise Anticipate problems and recommend innovative solutions; achieve customer satisfaction through the sale of sound consulting projects Hit quotas each quarter, as this is a quota-carrying Services Sales role Travel 10-20% What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience in an enterprise level software consulting or services sales Bachelor’s Degree 2+ years of experience as a consultant Preferred Proven track record for attaining and exceeding annual quota Ability to collaborate with sales to build and execute complex account strategies and sales plays Ability to scope and estimate projects and drive contracts and deals to closure Understanding of enterprise development lifecycle (Agile, Hybrid, Waterfall) and ability to communicate the differences between each as well as how projects are managed in each approach Knowledge of SaaS and Cloud-based enterprise software offerings Ability to lead initiatives and support the growth of other Engagement Managers on the team Collaborative and open to support the team on deals, processes, and share skills of how to be most productive as an Engagement Manager Self-starter that initiates their own personal growth through independent learning of DocuSign Agreement Cloud and methods to support customers in digitizing their System of Agreement Excellent team building, verbal, and written communication skills as well as reporting and presentation expertise This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming.
