jobTitle: Senior Marketing Manager, Pipeline Programs and Content Strategy
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The North America Marketing team at DocuSign is hiring a Senior Marketing Manager, Pipeline Program and Content Strategy to build and maintain a strategy and process for developing, launching and measuring content and pipeline programs that support our outbound prospecting efforts. This role will require collaboration across Marketing, Sales, and Operations teams; empowering them to do their best work. You’re an ideal candidate if you have experience designing, implementing, and using operating frameworks to enable scaled success across multiple teams involved in prospecting content strategy, planning, and optimization. This team is focused on maintaining and optimizing our customer engagement through our Outreach.io. You will be responsible for driving cross-functional alignment, coordination, and governance across Sales, Marketing, and Pipeline Program Managers to drive and maintain adoption of this program and function for the organization. You will also be expected to develop a communication plan, program roadmap and optimization opportunities that you will present to an executive audience. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to VP, Country Marketing and is designated Flex. Responsibility Own the Outreach Content Operating Model Policy and Process, which involves Intake and Approvals, Content Creation, Operations and Install, Enablement, and Ongoing Optimization Oversee and drive Global Content Intake and Approvals while maintaining clear SLAs, prioritization of content requests, and delegation of content creation to broader marketing organization, as well as installing and enabling on new content in the Outreach platform Develop a playbook of pipeline programs based on best practices across teams Identify opportunities to automate and scale programs for the largest possible impact Enable individual pipeline program managers with the tools to leverage best practices, and collate success and learnings for senior leadership Determine prioritization of content and program roll-outs across multiple team requests and communicating roadmap decisions Oversee measurement of content and pipeline program performance while recommending optimization opportunities Measure success through qualitative and quantitative metrics that align to business priorities, and defining optimization recommendations Communicate request progress and performance metrics progression regularly to working teams and stakeholder audiences, and manage an open feedback loop to ensure communication is bidirectional Leverage performance data to drive strategic A/B Testing, communication channel optimization, and messaging cadence Support change management processes and relationships while predicting roadblocks and obstacles in the process What you bring Basic Minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 6 years related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years experience; or equivalent experience. 4+ years of experience building, optimizing and scaling programs across various stakeholders and business units. 3+ years of experience influencing and securing buy in from an executive audience, influencing stakeholders and negotiating across disparate teams Preferred Outreach.io Admin Certification Prior experience in outbound prospecting in a SaaS company Prior experience in Sales or Marketing Experience developing and maturing program governance and management Experience with content marketing process management, workflow, and life cycle managementDegree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field encouraged Experience mitigating and managing through conflicting priorities and opposition to change Prior experience with Sales Engagement Platforms, preferably Outreach.io Experience with collaboration and influencing across functional boundaries, and demonstrating effective prioritization skills Experience communicating to all levels within an organization Experience prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously Experience working independently across multiple projects and partners This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $105,400 - $145,000 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $112,500 - $154,725 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Your data-driven analyses will enable the Marketing team to make decisions that improve productivity and increase the impact of our Marketing spend. Your curiosity will lead you to people from all levels and departments, and you will work on a broad set of projects that range from planning, target setting, and performance analysis, just to name a few. You have an analytical mindset and enjoy telling a story based on the underlying data. You prefer to solve a problem rather than simply point out that one has arisen. You understand that in order to achieve our long- term vision, we need to make the right decisions today. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP, Marketing Strategy and Planning and is designated Flex. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The DocuSign AI team builds Machine Learning solutions that power insights and automation for the entire DocuSign Agreement Cloud. We have built industry-leading Document AI products and features, all leveraging an enormous wealth of text and image data and deep computer vision and natural language models. Our group is pioneering the Smart Agreement Cloud of the future and we’re looking for experienced, driven, and diverse industry experts who want to be part of building that future together. No matter who our customer is, where they do business, or what they’re agreeing on, our team would like to simplify and optimize their business processes around contract negotiation, execution, and post-signature analysis. Our ultimate goal is to make the world more agreeable by empowering all of our customers with automated expertise. We’re looking for passionate and talented engineers to build out the machine learning platform and infrastructure that will power DocuSign’s Agreement Cloud. You will help support all aspects of the machine learning lifecycle, including the research platform, training and deployment systems, and scalable serving infrastructure. Our team is responsible for building a platform that supports an international team of machine learning engineers and data scientists and can serve AI solutions to DocuSign at scale. This role will be a part of the Foundations Machine Learning team at DocuSign, which builds analytics products that utilize AI, machine learning, and cutting-edge CV/NLP deep learning based models to provide insights for the DocuSign Agreement Cloud. Our team is distributed across the Bay Area, Seattle, Europe, and Egypt and you will be working collaboratively across these teams. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Engineering Manager and is designated Flex. Responsibility Think about how to build distributed systems at scale with enterprise-grade security and reliability Drive testing, releases, and monitoring of machine learning based products Write high quality, shippable code across the stack that is easy to maintain and test Collaborate with Applied Science and Product teams to ensure successful and timely delivery of new machine learning products and features Work collaboratively across different time zones and geographies Develop highly scalable and reliable machine learning infrastructure that can perform model training and evaluation Build vital tools and infrastructure to monitor and understand the performance of complex systems What you bring Basic 8+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 6 years related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years of experience; or equivalent experience Experience building/consuming RESTful and gRPC based web-services Experience with CI/CD build pipelines, integrated tests, and test-driven development Familiarity with cloud deployment technologies, such as Kubernetes or Docker containers Experience with designing and scaling fullstack or distributed backend systems Experience with building carrier grade availability services Preferred Ideal candidates have past experience building machine learning products, data pipelines, or machine learning training and deployment systems. Experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models Ability and desire to move across technology stacks fluently and easily This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do Collaborate with our customers while providing consulting services and expert project management governance, ensuring success of their implementation. We are looking for a Senior Project Manager (PM) to join our Professional Services team. The DocuSign Professional Services team manages customer implementation and integration projects. The goals of the Senior PM are to develop and manage the schedules for consulting engagements, ensure proactive communication to clients and internal staff, manage enhancement requirements and escalations, and overall project governance. You will use the DocuSign Project Management Methodology to initiate, plan, design, execute, monitor, control and close projects. You will manage risks, including making decisions to reduce uncertainty. The PM will play a critical role in the success of the Professional Services team. We are expanding a world class Professional Services organization that already has a proven track record of working with Fortune 500 IT departments, system integrators, independent software manufacturers and open source communities. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to Director, Project Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Manage projects, ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery and guidance to project resources and our customers Provide impactful solutions that result in highly referenceable accounts, enabling strong adoption, renewal and upsell Plan, organize and manage all phases of a project to ensure customer satisfaction Be customer centric in style and approach, with a genuine desire to create and deliver value for customers throughout the project and deliver an outstanding customer experience Collaborate with the DocuSign team to proactively uncover additional customer needs and support documenting client requirements and expectations Meet all Professional Services team success criteria including utilization target, customer satisfaction score and financial requirements Adopt and evangelize our DocuSign implementation methodology and provide ongoing input to maintain and enhance our methodology Support organization initiatives to enhance and expand our team’s knowledge and our services offerings Maintain up to date required product knowledge including connectors and partner products as appropriate for your role Provide mentorship to less experienced team members What Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is looking for Senior Engineers to join our development team in Seattle or San Francisco. This position will be part of a team working on DocuSign's Platform that's responsible for high scale and low latency service. The service will deliver a No-Code Business Process Automation framework that allows administrators or delegates to build agreement management workflows without having to have any coding experience. This position will demand critical thinking skills, ability to quickly understand existing systems and the ability to work in agile environments. The ability to take smart and educated risks is essential to the success of this position. If you have all of that and a passion for building quality experiences to make it easier for customers to manage their users of DocuSign, then we want to talk to you! This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director of Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Think about how to solve problems in scale and build fault tolerant systems Develop high-quality, ship-ready code that is covered by a full test suite Design and develop a web-scale service that follows microservices principles and is deployed using containerized cloud technologies to allow customer administrators the ability to construct simple business processes without having to have coding expertise Work with Product Management and other developers to understand and translate marketing requirements into design requirements and provide estimates for development Work as part of a cross-site development team to drive design, implementation, testing and release of products What you bring Basic 8+ years of development experience or equivalent Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, Informatics or equivalent. Experience with data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and distributed systems fundamentals Experience working with C#, Go, Java, TypeScript, JavaScript or other modern programming languages Preferred Experience with Cloud Technologies (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP, or equivalent) Experience building Cloud Native Services using REST APIs, Microservices based architectures, and containerized technologies (e.g. K8S, and Docker) Experience designing, developing, troubleshooting and debugging multi-regional web-services Strong organizational, problem-solving and communication skills Experience designing and operating large-scale cloud services, including troubleshooting and performance tuning Experience in high-scale distributed systems and fault tolerant design Experience with Agile and Test-driven development methodologies Experiences with the entire software development lifecycle, including version control (git), CICD pipelines, testing, and regional cloud deployments Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-moving environment, prioritize your work and manage your own time A passion to learn new software technologies This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $130,800 - $184,800 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $139,000 - $196,375 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Terraform Define and manage KPIs and other measurements to indicate the health of security-related programs Provide on-call support of the security infrastructure systems Research and development of security and systems in order to engineer working solutions to improve the cyber security posture of DocuSign What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience designing and delivering enterprise technology solutions 4+ years of experience in cloud computing technologies (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, etc.), including software, infrastructure, and platform-as-a-service, as well as public, private, and hybrid environments Experience with programming languages and scripting, such as Python, JS, Powershell, Terraform, Cloudformation, etc. 4+ years of Security Engineering or Operations security, and application security understanding Preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience Excellence in communicating business risk from cybersecurity issues A proven deep background in technology design, implementation, and delivery Strong analytical skills to interpret and translate Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Sr Software Engineer on the Platform Notifications team will build services and tools to enhance and standardize notifications and data models between our applications and services, and with our customers. A successful person in this role will help define the vision, approach and our roadmap. They will collaborate with other development teams to understand their cross-application and application-to-customer communication requirements and how their applications contribute to a shared data model. They will then help develop shared services to support these requirements. Examples of the types of projects to be developed include building a notification platform to support app-to-app messaging as well as app-to-customer notifications via SMS and email. Along with collaboration tools, creating and evolving a shared data model to enhance the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, and supporting our internal development engineers and operations team as they learn, use and monitor these services. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager Engineering Platform Notifications and is designated Flex. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Foundation Data platform team is chartered to build the backend for ML model building and reporting needs for customers. We create, maintain and operate scalable technology and data solutions that deliver an exceptional experience for our customers. We embrace Agile principles and values, favor DevOps practices, and view infrastructure as code, all while we create an infrastructure that scales and supports our growth and ambitious vision. This requires a smart, highly collaborative team who can identify, investigate, and implement new technologies to continue securely scaling our global business. DocuSign is looking for amazing Software Engineers to join our development team. This position will be part of a team working on an architectural shift that will allow us to scale to meet the next 10x of growth. We need engineers who are ready to grapple with unique requirements of partner teams and build a hybrid cloud development and execution environment. We need to build expertise to configure, deploy and execute different cloud platforms to support containerization and microservices architecture. This position will demand critical thinking skills, ability to learn and understand complex cloud platforms and the ability to work in agile environments. The ability to take smart and educated risks is essential to the success of this position. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of Engineering and is designated Flex. jobTitle: Sr. Campaign Performance, Optimization & Insights Manager
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Senior Campaign Performance, Optimization & Insights Manager fills a key role in the planning and execution of marketing strategies. This is done through the analysis of campaign performance metrics, including responses, MQL, and SQO data, along with a deep understanding of account strategies, prospect and customer personas, and key target segments that make up the Marketing Database. This is a highly collaborative role within the Database Marketing and Campaign Operations (DBCOPS) team to support global demand programs designed to leverage persona and cohort data in order to set KPIs, predict outcomes, execute and measure campaign performance and make running campaign adjustments based on real-time data. While this role manages a lot of data and reports, the focus is on data strategies that create actionable information for Marketing, Sales, and other teams. Technical in nature and skills, this role is best suited for a Marketer that is passionate about leveraging data to drive campaign ROI and other marketing metrics. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director, Database Marketing & Campaign Operations and is designated Flex. Responsibility Perform detailed analysis of key performance metrics for global marketing teams, programs, campaigns, and tactics Generate weekly reports, scorecards, dashboards, and alerts for Global Demand Center teams Manage and produce actionable marketing-based reporting and analysis for internal stakeholders Drive metric-driven environment Develop and execute plans to utilize our customer data and research data to drive ROI Develop creative ways to communicate messages to our internal global business partners Work with the Global Demand Center (GDC) teams to deliver information to leadership across all country business partners and other stakeholder teams Generate predictive models for marketing planning and attribution Monitor key performance indicators across a variety of subjects, watching for changes outside standard benchmarks for responses, leads, lead qualification, and opportunities Assist in the development and execution of marketing campaigns Drive optimization efforts for lead qualification in support of marketing campaigns Research and develop best practices for reporting and analysis What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience with digital marketing data and analysis Experience connecting paid media tools, CRM, marketing automation and social media reporting tools with Google Analytics Experience with attribution modeling Experience in an enterprise B2B marketing environment Experience with data visualization Experience in data analysis and report generation with Microsoft Excel and Tableau Preferred Expert knowledge in digital metrics, dimensions and KPIs Strong functional understanding of the marketing funnel, lead scoring, campaign attribution/ROI, customer journey mapping, and sales opportunity funnel dynamics Strong technical abilities (SQL, Python, etc.) and experience working with databases Strong attention to detail Ability to work independently and proactively identify potential issues and work toward solutions Results-oriented team player with the ability to build and maintain productive relationships with peers and cross-functional teams Adaptable to changing priorities Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set priorities, and execute on tight deadlines This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $105,400 - $145,000 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $112,500 - $154,725 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. This role involves leading and handling cutting-edge and complex legal projects and matters. You should thrive in an environment that requires you to adapt to changing priorities and organizational needs. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Deputy General Counsel for Corporate, Securities, Employment and Litigation and is designated Flex. Resources and senior business partners on employment-related matters, including hiring, performance management, terminations, discrimination, harassment, accommodations, leaves of absence, wage and What you'll do The Senior GTM Strategy and Operations Manager is a highly motivated self-starter who drives sales reporting, analyses, and insights to accelerate the growth of our business. What you'll do The Sr. People Analytics Consultant is a dynamic role where you will be responsible for completing complex analytics projects and advising assigned stakeholder groups by leveraging our tools, data, and additional external research. You will develop relationships within your assigned stakeholder groups to understand their business challenges and respond through various analytics products (e.g., data storytelling briefings, reports, and dashboards). You will develop actionable recommendations and support your stakeholders through implementation of these recommendations. You will be highly data-driven, consultative, technically astute, a solid communicator, intellectually curious, a fast learner, and able to move quickly while keeping focused on multiple high impact projects with limited direction and supervision. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, People Analytics and is designated as Flex. Responsibility Collaborate with assigned stakeholders to scope analytics needs for projects Partner with various system and operations teams to obtain data required for analysis Develop data storytelling briefings, reports, and dashboards through tools such as Visier, Glint, Tableau, and Google Slides Conduct external best practices and other research to enhance data storytelling Foster a culture of analytics self-service by building scalable analytics products and enabling assigned stakeholders through change management techniques (i.e., communications and training) Monitor stakeholder areas to proactively bring issues forward and recommend additional analysis opportunities Serve as the analytics subject matter expert for assigned stakeholder areas staying current on business operations and strategy Leverage both descriptive and inferential statistics techniques to support each analytics project to maximize impact Maintain high levels of customer satisfaction from assigned stakeholders What you bring Basic Seasoned People Analytics Professional with minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 5 years related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years of experience; or equivalent experience Knowledge of People and HR topics such as such as talent acquisition, talent development, workforce planning, and learning and development Experience in Excel and/or Google Sheets (including pivot tables and formulas) General knowledge of inferential statistics techniques (e.g., correlation, regression, decision trees) and how each technique can be applied to various stakeholder challenges in addition to experience using this knowledge to partner with appropriate internal experts to run the analysis Experience with quantitative and qualitative research methods Preferred Preferred degree with quantitative focus (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Industrial and Organizational Psychology, Engineering) and/or degree in Human Resources Ability to analyze data across multiple sources and distill insights to provide stakeholders a meaningful story that drives strategy, action, and decision-making Ability to work autonomously and proven experience leading complex and cross-functional initiatives, processes, or projects Strong interpersonal skills and collaborative work-style with the ability to build relationships with all levels of stakeholders to drive organizational change Tech savvy with an ability to quickly learn new tools People Analytics experience in a high-growth or tech environment Specific experience with Visier, Glint, Tableau, and Google Business Suite Preferred degree with quantitative focus (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Engineering) and/or degree in Human Resources This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do The AI Feature Product Manager will work and cooperate with the Data Platform team to define and develop data requirements for the relevant AI features, with the Applied Science team to manage the model training and testing and with the Infrastructure Engineering team to deploy and integrate the features within the DocuSign associated core product. The main focus of the AI Features and Infra Product Management Team is to deliver deep AI/ML-driven outcomes at all stages of the agreement lifecycle and across all the DocuSign Agreement Platform. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Lead Technical Product Manager and is designated Flex. Responsibility Own the roadmap and deliver AI/ML-based features and applications necessary to support continued system scale, a broadening product portfolio, and the basis for new innovative product capabilities, and operational efficiencies Establish and manage the vision and roadmap for key AI/ML platform capabilities such as model design, experimentation, development, and deployment, leading trade-offs among priorities, strategic bets, and other considerations Create a delightful product experience powered by the ML platform and used by all AI practitioners at DocuSign with an emphasis on the Digital Signature experience Establish strong partnerships with key stakeholders across DocuSign to enable durable and reusable AI-powered products Articulate DocuSign AI vision, strategies, priorities, and desired outcomes Partner closely with strategic partners of DocuSign to align on technology partnerships while laser-focused on building the right user experience of the highest quality for the self-serve capabilities What you bring Basic 8+ years of experience in product management (candidates with fewer years of experience may be considered) Previous experience in developing and introducing AI/ML products to the market Good understanding of ML Ops cycle: data - Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. What you'll do As Senior Product Marketing Manager, CLM, you will be responsible for communicating value and increasing marketing effectiveness for DocuSign’s Contract Lifecycle Management product. You’ll drive product messaging and positioning, collaborate with demand generation and other parts of marketing to create high impact content and build a pipeline for the product. You’ll work with Business Development to grow our relationship with Salesforce, our largest and most important ecosystem partner. You’ll enable our Sales teams with content and tools aligned to customer needs in various stages of the sales cycle. You’ll work cross-functionally with Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and senior leadership. This position is an individual contributor reporting to the Sr. Director, Product Marketing and is designated Flex. Responsibility Own the positioning, messaging, and value propositions of DocuSign CLM Create, lead, manage, and measure product marketing and lead generation initiatives to showcase the value of DocuSign’s CLM product and capabilities to target markets Partner with Demand Generation to define market segmentation and campaign strategy Lead efforts to create the high impact messaging and assets required to execute Work with Business Development to ensure that our key ecosystem partners have the messaging, content and tools they need to be successful channel partners Collaborate with Sales Enablement to ensure that content, tools, and other product marketing assets are effectively deployed to, and used by, the field Support strategic customer and internal events (e.g. customer/partner conferences, sales meetings) by owning development of presentations/sessions/training Collaborate with Product Management to ensure that new products and functionality are featured, packaged, priced, launched, and communicated effectively What you bring Basic 8+ years of product marketing (or similar) in the B2B SaaS space BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills Preferred Experience marketing solutions in the Salesforce ecosystem Experience in one or more of the following categories: Contract Lifecycle Management, Configure-Price-Quote (CPQ), Customer Relationship Management , Document Generation. jobTitle: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, eSignature GTM
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign’s vision is to provide the leading apps and platform technologies for companies to modernize their systems of agreement, from preparing agreements to getting them signed to fulfilling the terms and finally, reporting on, retaining and retrieving agreements. As Senior Product Marketing Manager - eSignature GTM, you will be responsible for helping drive the adoption, cross-sell, and upsell in our eSignature line of products. You’ll work cross-functionally with product, demand generation, digital customer success and sales teams to drive segmentation, map the customer journey, optimize the full-funnel experience, and accelerate growth. This position is an individual contributor reporting to the Director of Product Marketing and is designated Flex. Responsibility Partner with digital marketing, digital customer success, sales and product management to create compelling campaigns that drive acquisition, adoption, and upsell opportunities through owned and paid channels, including in-product communication Uncover customer insights to improve the customer journey, drive better experiences, and account growth Refine and optimize messaging based on these insights Partner with the product, digital experience and pricing team to shape how the in-product narrative, evolves and scales to attract, engage and retain the different segments across our eSignature product line Build a community of customer evangelists by driving a consistent narrative, in partnership with Customer Success What you bring Basic Experience with product-led growth strategies 8+ years of product marketing experience in the B2B SaaS space Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with clear examples of using data for customer insights and recommendations Proven track record of working with multiple cross-functional teams Proven ability to understand and simplify complex, technical topics for non-technical audiences Preferred MBA degree Excellent verbal and written communication skills Self-starter who can accomplish projects with minimal need for supervision Highly collaborative, enthusiastic, open, proactive, and results-driven This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do As a self-motivated Senior SaaS Engineer, you will help us build, maintain, and rationalize our internal SaaS ecosystem. This role will involve day-to-day management of SaaS applications critical to our business, enforcing vendor management and SaaS policies, and working with business stakeholders to maximize the value delivery of their SaaS portfolios. You’ll be joining our Cloud Applications team which comprises system engineers and administrators responsible for overall SaaS ownership and strategy. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Sr. Director, End User Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Partner with business stakeholders to architect, implement, configure, and maintain corporate SaaS applications like Google Workspace, Okta, Microsoft Office 365, Slack, and others Deploy and maintain cloud-based applications, systems, and associated cloud infrastructure Help define our SaaS blueprint and establish a cross-functional intake, management, and support model Build critical trust and relationships with business and technical stakeholders Orchestrate and automate key cloud-based business platforms throughout the company Define and evangelize new productivity and collaboration patterns to support a hybrid working environment Maintain a security-first approach to development, configuration, and administration What you bring Basic Minimum of 8 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related degree or 6 years of related experience with a Master’s degree in Computer Science or related degree Experience architecting end to end collaboration and productivity solutions Experience deploying, administering, supporting and migrating between SaaS applications and platforms in an enterprise environment Experience as admin for Google Workspace (i.e. core applications, security tools, and identity management) Experience with one of the programming or scripting languages, such as C# or Python Experience using REST APIs to integrate standalone SaaS applications into a broad architecture landscape Experience building lightweight business applications Google Workspace, Google Apps Script and AppSheet Preferred Admin-level experience with Microsoft Active Directory and Office 365 Admin-level experience with Okta including SAML authentication, custom apps, SCIM provisioning, and Okta Workflow). Experience working with identity and access management including unified profiles and role based access control Experience architecting data integration and workflow platforms (e.g. Mulesoft, Workato, Zapier) Experience integrating and migrating SaaS applications and defining architecture standards Experience building custom APIs and RESTful services Proven experience with common cloud infrastructure platforms including AWS, Azure, and GCP Self starter with ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks with minimal direction or supervision Strong team player willing to take responsibility, accountability and ownership This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Experience with Grafana and Istio live mesh. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The Technical Support Engineer is the strategic customer advisor and the internal voice for our customer base within the highest technical areas of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud. The Technical Support Engineer will both have the accountability and responsibility to deliver on our customers’ needs. This role is the technical subject matter expert between customers and all functional areas within DocuSign to resolve technical support inquiries. Working with resources across DocuSign, the Technical Support Engineer expedites the resolution of complex technical issues to empower customers to achieve the highest value and adoption of our software. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Technical Support Manager and is designated Flex. Due To Government Contract Requirements Candidate must be a U.S. citizen Candidate must be able to clear a government agency-specific background investigation and may be required to undergo additional background checks, including fingerprinting, drug testing, and/or other government-required investigations to obtain and/or maintain security clearance(s) Responsibility Provide exceptional technical support for the DocuSign Agreement Cloud (DAC) and associated services Manage and resolve escalated cases of incoming support channels to troubleshoot issues customers face when using DocuSign products Own customer issues to engineering interface to resolve technical bugs and influence development roadmap Use broad technical product expertise within DAC areas to help customers increase adoption Meet and exceed DocuSign Customer Support service level goals for areas of DAC expertise Utilize support tools and resources necessary to get the job done, including telephone, Salesforce, Jira, DocuSign proprietary logging systems, SharePoint, browser developer tools, internal admin console, SQL, and text analysis tooling Identify proactively improvements to the product, identify bugs and otherwise determine high-impact opportunities to enhance the customer experience Promote DocuSign products and services to customers and prospective customers via consultative discussion and evaluation of their service and support needs Partner with non-delivery teams to identify needs and develop product training Collaborate and communicate with cross-functional teams including Product, Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do This is an exciting, strategic role that combines the competencies of value analysis and strategy consulting. We’re looking for an exceptional individual to join our Value Management team and be a key player in further developing the DocuSign Customer Value Program. In this role, you will work closely with our Value Management teams to ensure a successful engagement with customers and prospects. You will have an opportunity to directly influence DocuSign’s largest sales engagements and support DocuSign’s accelerated growth. You will support accounts across all steps in the customer lifecycle, from strategic alignment, project justification, and commercial proposals to value measurement and realization of targeted business outcomes. The Value Analyst role works closely with customer-facing Value Consultants, account teams, and cross functional internal stakeholders to design, deliver, and manage at-scale tools, resources, and enablement programs. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director of Solution Engineering and is designated Flex. Responsibility Work closely with the Value Management team, Sales, Customer Success, Product, and Marketing to understand how DocuSign helps customers meet their strategic objectives by identifying key business drivers Facilitate the aggregation and analysis of industry and customer data, create a framework, and design resources and tools that help the sales team and customers understand and quantify the impact of the DocuSign platform Create and deliver enablement sessions and resources to coach the sales teams on Value Selling and use our models and tools to sell with value Support qualitative and quantitative analysis of specific sales opportunities, both bespoke (customer specific) and at-scale (benchmarking) Conduct and facilitate internal and external research and discovery around customer business processes and market trends to benchmark DocuSign customers for best practices and value achieved Create impactful presentation templates that articulate the value of DocuSign and drive executive level engagement with targeted opportunities Analyze and report on the effectiveness and impact of the Customer Value Program What you bring Basic BA/BS degree or equivalent in a quantitative field (business, finance, economics, math, engineering, marketing) or related area Experience with financial modeling and data visualization with experience incorporating data into compelling storylines for executive-level conversations Preferred 2+ years of professional related experience in Sales, Industry Solutions, Value Engineering or Business Transformation MBA Demonstrated skills in design and facilitation of executive-level workshops Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various levels of functional knowledge Strong analytical skills, including mastery of data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau, python, etc.) Product and Program management experience, including communication, driving user adoption and enablement Ability to work across multiple functions, disciplines, cultures, and geographies in a highly collaborative and engaging fashion Strong track record of building and maintaining effective customer relationships Ability to travel as required when the COVID-19 situation permits (travel less than 20% typically) This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado hourly pay range: $32.26/hour - $40.74/hour and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City hourly pay range: $35.00/hour - $42.90/hour and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do The ideal candidate will have leadership experience in enterprise SAAS products and have demonstrated excellence in building and managing agile product development teams. This role requires extensive collaboration both internally and externally. You will drive a unified product strategy and roadmap with the aim of driving the delightful DocuSign experience to all our customers and partners and drive synergies across the APEX portfolio in four critical areas. These include: Joint and embedded solutions with our most strategic application ecosystem partners - Salesforce, Microsoft, Google; Document Management Services such as Document Editor, Document Templates, Document Generation Services, and Document Transformation Services; Data, Analytics, Monitoring and Reporting; Provisioning, Billing, Metering, and entitlement monitoring experiences. Key stakeholders will include Product Pillar owners, Platform services teams, product marketing, business development, sales, customers, and partners. The right candidate will continue building our culture of accountability and empowerment while bringing new ideas to drive agility and velocity of deliverables with quantifiable results. This role will make a critical impact on DocuSign’s core product and the industry, collaborating with a strong team. This leader will also drive a culture of diversity, innovation, mentorship and nurturing and ensure that we attract and develop talented product managers and leaders across multiple locations. This position is a people manager reporting to Group Vice President, Product Management and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead a small team of product managers who work in a matrix set up across both the APEX and Platform Product Management teams Foster a culture of mentoring and professional development across the team with measurable outcomes Bring a strategic mindset and arbitrate between business and engineering needs with a mindset towards delivery What you bring Basic 10+ years of experience leading enterprise application product management teams 10+ years of Experience in building and delivering successful products across 3 GTM motions - PLG based self service motions, SaaS inside sales based commercial sales, and Enterprise sales Bachelors and/or Masters Degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with an MBA Preferred Deep understating of Persona, JTBD, and business outcome based product definition and development models Solid understanding of building world class products, consumed by billions of consumers on Cloud or consumption based architectures Strong comfort and experience in working within a cross functional environment with Dev, User Exp. And Program Management Team Structured thinker who is a self starter, scrappy, and passionate in breaking down silos to deliver Demonstrated success in building mentoring, and transforming product management professionals into Industry Product Leaders Excellent written, oral, and presentation skills Ideal candidates started their career in product development, QA, Technical Support, Professional services This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is looking to hire a senior sales executive to develop commercial optimization strategies that maximize revenue and adoption for DocuSign in our largest customers. The candidate will engage with DocuSign’s Enterprise sales team, and top strategic customers to shape and negotiate complex deal structures that support DocuSign’s growth strategy. The VP, Strategic Sales will drive strong alignment with DocuSign Enterprise Sales leaders and stakeholders across the company to define and execute effective global sales strategies and best practices that optimize the revenue per customer. The candidate will understand SaaS competitive tactics and the enterprise customer buying behaviors to effectively structure the commercial strategy against them. The VP, Strategic Sales will provide guidance on deal design and optimization to the field and engage in negotiations with key Customer C-Level Executives to drive successful deal closure as required. With direct customer engagement and feedback, the VP, Strategic Sales will also provide feedback into pricing and packaging and other DocuSign processes and stakeholders. The candidate will have a deep understanding of end-to-end complex deal execution and the revenue recognition impact on competitive pricing and margin. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Group Vice President, Enterprise Sales and is designated flex. Responsibility Support the DocuSign GVP, Enterprise in defining the roles and responsibilities to build out the Strategic Sales team for FY24 (CY 2023) Define archetypes within the Enterprise segment to prioritize accounts for enterprise agreement proposals Develop Enterprise narrative and value proposition that support large scale commercial agreement proposals Understand competitor tactics and effectively structure the commercial strategy to support a DocuSign win Provide guidance on deal design and optimization to the account teams Engage in negotiations with key C-Level Customer Executives as required Drive deal approval cycle with DocuSign and Customer stakeholders for complex agreements Support escalations to delivery, commercial, legal and product teams for complex enterprise agreements Drive repeatable best practices and methodology Define and drive implementation of go-to-market strategies and programs that result in quantifiable business impact Be responsible for the professional development of direct reports and organization by understanding your team’s skill levels, working styles, motivations, and professional goals Enhance management capabilities to meet strategic and operating objectives Operate as a role model in the company and industry by establishing a strong collaborative culture with peers and other functions within DocuSign Promote a culture of diversity, inclusion, belonging, work ethic, accountability, positive attitude, team collaboration, success, pride, performance, discipline, and creativity What you bring Basic 15 to 20 years of experience in sales of complex business software/IT solutions 8+ years of sales leadership experience, specifically within business application software sales with a successful track record in complex sales to large global enterprise accounts Experience in complex, matrixed account team selling environment Demonstrated success with 8-9 figure Cloud transactions and lengthy sales campaigns in a fast-paced, consultative and highly competitive market Experience developing and maintaining business, sales, and market plans as well as best in class contracting, negotiating and closing of large-scale complex deals Strong verbal, written and executive presentation skills with demonstrated ability to align quantitative and quantitative data analysis Strong analytical capabilities, be organized and have demonstrated the ability to work on multiple objectives while synthesizing feedback from different stakeholders Quota-attainment record of meeting and/or exceeding targets Strong cross-team collaboration and ability to partner with multiple stakeholders including Sales Management, Strategy and Operations, Finance, and Product Knowledge of advanced technologies and business processes Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed Expert selling into a variety of industries and geographies, cultivating and sustaining key strategic relationships Expert strategic planning and consultative skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. What you'll do DocuSign is looking to hire a senior sales executive to develop commercial optimization strategies that maximize revenue and adoption for DocuSign in our largest customers. The candidate will engage with DocuSign’s Enterprise sales team, and top strategic customers to shape and negotiate complex deal structures that support DocuSign’s growth strategy. The VP, Strategic Sales will drive strong alignment with DocuSign Enterprise Sales leaders and stakeholders across the company to define and execute effective global sales strategies and best practices that optimize the revenue per customer. The candidate will understand SaaS competitive tactics and the enterprise customer buying behaviors to effectively structure the commercial strategy against them. The VP, Strategic Sales will provide guidance on deal design and optimization to the field and engage in negotiations with key Customer C-Level Executives to drive successful deal closure as required. With direct customer engagement and feedback, the VP, Strategic Sales will also provide feedback into pricing and packaging and other DocuSign processes and stakeholders. The candidate will have a deep understanding of end-to-end complex deal execution and the revenue recognition impact on competitive pricing and margin. jobTitle: VP, Sales & Customer Success - Learning & Development
jobDescription: Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do In this role, your team will work with our Field Sales and Customer Success team members and you will be responsible for ensuring the Global Sales and Customer Success teams are equipped with the content and skills to manage their territory, account planning and deal execution. You are passionate about sales, sales methodologies, and processes, and thrive on helping others succeed. You will lead a team who deeply understands the core field competencies and determine how these are woven into everything that we do. You’ll have an opportunity to combine a passion for teaching and technology, to drive learning, and help our field achieve desired business outcomes. The successful candidate is an experienced senior executive who has great executive presence and is comfortable coaching others on how to engage in both virtual and in-person experiences. The Global Training team’s mission is to equip every DocuSign Field employee to do the work of their lives. We ensure that every member of the Field team has the skills, knowledge, process expertise and content to maximize every prospect and customer interaction in the most productive way possible. Enabling the Field to deliver a world-class buyer and seller experience that drives growth, adoption, retention, and customer satisfaction at scale is at the heart of what we do. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Vice President, Sales Strategy & Operations and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead the design, build, and delivery of transformational learning and development courses to accelerate the ability of our global field organization to effectively partner with sales decision makers to create a vision and deliver key business outcomes Lead by example with a focus on team collaboration, opportunities and growth for your employees Provide expertise in recommending, influencing and facilitating organizational, business and process change throughout the training process by applying appropriate change management tools and techniques Develop a deep understanding of the sales skills needs in region through collaboration with leaders and individual contributors across the different segments and roles (ie: Account Executives, Solution Engineers, Renewal Managers, xDR, CSMs) Deliver post-program sales and sales leadership coaching to drive ongoing application of learning and support organizational up-skilling and transformation Collaborate closely with peers and employees on the global enablement team to maximize the impact of global sales skills programs in region by ensuring they are relevant and by driving adoption in region Grow and uplevel your team to be involved in the strategy for learning and development Include your team at the table for the entire lifecycle of an initiative Drive programs that incorporate the strategy, mission, and technology with our sales and business development methodologies Engage with key stakeholders to help drive continuous learning behavior changes and to deliver iterative Learning & Development solutions Investigate root causes of process inefficiencies and makes proposals on opportunities for improvement Partner with upstream and downstream learning process owners to proactively identify areas for improving quality and user experience Grow your team into a metrics driven organization to track consumption and further enable teams to be accountable for learning and development Build and maintain strong partnerships with the subject matter experts and members of the project team based on a shared commitment to achieving business results Apply innovation and design thinking techniques to continually challenge and improve the efficiency, scale, and resilience of our training solutions Design and develop leadership learning portfolio roadmaps and programs in partnership with key stakeholders Build and establish relationships with the immediate team across the organization, characterized by a high level of acceptance, cooperation, and mutual respect What you bring Basic Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree Minimum of 10 years of progressive learning experience and/or enablement leadership experience Experience gathering and shaping business requirements and defining learning strategy, design, and operations Instructional design expertise: requires assessment, design, and development of programs Experience working with and leading complex, global teams on large learning projects Experience with designing self service “how to” and on-demand content for the Field Proven technology and business experience Preferred Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively, including the ability to influence without direct authority Proven ability to work, influence, be inclusive and communicate effectively across all levels within an organization Excellent communication skills This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Company Overview DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. What you'll do DocuSign is looking for a manager to join the team and own Xactly System Administration, working cross functionally with a broad set of business partners across our global Compensation teams. They will use business process understanding, appreciation for detail and quality, critical thinking, and a roll-up-the-sleeves attitude to craft holistic solutions that meet business and technology objectives while furthering scalable long-term automation goals. They will be responsible for all technical developments, configuration, maintenance, and performance of Xactly Sales Compensation plans. This is a fast-paced position with the capability to help automate the many business processes that surround our unique sales and rewards programs. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, Sales GTM Compensation and is designated Flex. Responsibility Lead and manage the operation, performance, maintenance, and optimization of the company’s Xactly environment and its integration with other Sales systems Optimize and re-engineer existing Xactly architecture from a technical perspective to support company growth in a scalable way where needed Design and configure complex comp plan changes in Xactly and ensure all business rules and policies are behaving as planeed with extensive testing Ensure accurate source data load for calculations and commission payments to our sales organization Manage all daily administrative functions including, workflows, payroll and accrual reviews, adjustment requests, manual data loads, reconciliation efforts, reports and other configurations Collaborate with teams to drive system integration and automation to enhance business processes Understand and Maintain data integration from a variety of inbound and outbound lead sources Manage sales compensation projects and requests relating to data analysis, report building and distribution Identify opportunities to track and optimize Xactly sales compensation system and help rollout new features Create automation to maintain data hygiene and adherence to best practice Complete regular internal system audits and plan for the releases from Vendors Maintain System Security and Integrity What you bring Basic BA/BS in a related field 8+ years of hands-on experience with Technical Sales Compensation Administration, including recent success working within the Xactly Platform Level 3 certified Xactly incent and plan configuration Preferred Strong understanding of the Xactly Sales Compensation platform; with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, Email templates, auto-response rules, assignment rules, and validation rules A demonstrated track record of improving processes and effectiveness of the Xactly platform Ability to see projects from both a big-picture and task-specific point of view Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Xactly and all upstream and downstream applications, systems, and processes Comfortable in a fast-paced environment and capable of meeting short-deadline projects daily Excellent attention to detail and willingness to pitch in when necessary Strong understanding of Salesforce.com, Anaplan, and Snowflake and best practices and functionality Strong understanding of business practices and processes in the customer life cycle of software subscriptions Experience using Data loader to maintain data integrity and quality; hands on experience in performing complex data loads This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Based on Colorado law, the following details are for Colorado individuals only: Colorado base salary range: $115,800 - $163,575 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits. Based on legislation in New York City, the following details are for individuals who reside and would be working in New York City only: New York City base salary range: $123,600 - $174,525 and eligible for bonus, equity and benefits.
